Reviews.Title: “Comfortable One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: ardac
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed one night March14. I booked on Hotwire and got the room for $85. We have no complaints except that our air/heat system wasn't cooling very well...the temperature in Toronto was 22 degrees that day!! The room temp was comfortable none the less. My daughter and I arrived at 1:00 and were able to check in at that time. The gentleman who checked us in was polite and friendly, and gave my daugter a little welcome gift. We used the pool and hot tub in the afternoon and again later in the evening after my arrived. It was not a large pool, but bright and clean. The hot tub was nice and warm with strong jets. I thought it would be busier since it was march break, but there was never more than 3 or 4 other bathers when we were there. The beds were super comfy, we all had a great nights sleep. My husband did hear some street noise but it didn't keep us awake. We did call housekeeping for extra pillows, and also top sheets for the bed. There is a comfy duvet, but no top sheets...apparantly a "European" custom. the bathroom was clean and bright, and the shower had good pressure We did not eat at the hotel...had dinner across the street at the old spaghetti factory...cool decor, pleasant wait staff...the food was ok, reasonably priced. There is a little convenience store beside the hotel that sells basics and also has a counter where you can get sandwiches, and breakfast items. We bought BLT's , muffins , toast and tea etc for less than $20 in the morining. I would stay here again, it is a convenient location ( 10 min walk to Eaton Centre, 10-15 to Rogers Centre) The parking was $23 but we were able to stay parked untill midnight of checkout date at no extra charge. Any staff we encountered were all pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: mai n
Reviews.Content: The walls are thin! you can hear the next room! the rooms are small and the service was horrible. They never services our room after we had called them repeatedly to service it. The front desk concierge gave us attitude about it and couldn't offer anything to compensate for their poor service. They actually came into the room because they cleaned our garbage out and took note that we had opened a bottled water but they never took our dirty towels, they didn't make the bed, and they didn't give us new towels!! HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE! I have been to 3.5 star hotels and the hotel was not even close to being this bad. The air is really dry as well and the vending machines don't sell water. I thought this hotel was so nice until I got into the room and realized it was old and needed updates. You would be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: St3f
Reviews.Content: We stayed there only for a night. It was very pleasant, the rooms spacious and clean. There was free wifi, the parking right below was 17 something dollars and the location was great. Three minute walk to Air Canada Center. The price was also very reasonable. I actually have nothing to complaint about. I would stay there again, i would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: CDNTraveler21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week-long conference in downtown Toronto. The only good thing about this hotel is the location, but with so many other choices in the immediate area, that's not much of a selling point. I didn't get the room I reserved (or confirmed days before we left), which meant that my 8-month pregnant wife and I were both terribly uncomfortable. The beds were old, the decor and carpet even older, and the breakfast was just plain nasty. The room was too hot, even with the furnace turned off, and very dry. We had to run the shower in the middle of the night just so we could breathe. I thought Novotel was one of the higher-end chains, but it's not. Do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else, you'll be so much happier. (My colleagues LOVED the hotel at 1 King West).

Reviews.Title: “You'll be glad you stayed here”
Reviews.Author: Brenda R
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. We were steps away from Yonge Street, which was a bonus as the Eaton Center was just a short walk away from the hotel. The CN Tower is close to this hotel and there are great restaurants across the street. A short walk will have you to the harbour front if you want to take the ferry to the Toronto Islands or to Union Station, which is very close by. The staff are very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The rooms are very clean and the bed was so comfortable, that I slept like a baby. The hotel is decortaed in such a way that is has a real relaxing ambiance about it. I would definitley stay here again and I was very impressed with this hotel. If you like a latte in the morning, they can make that for you too!!!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Saranette
Reviews.Content: We paid for parking and when we left, we received two parking tickets. Angela Beecher from the hotel first claimed had no record of our reservation then said she'd pay the tickets then never responded again.Novotel customer service just forwards the inquiry emails back to her and she doesn't respond.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, decent coffee and free wifi”
Reviews.Author: sportyprincess
Reviews.Content: Any hotel in which you can't hear the neighbors AT ALL will earn four stars from me, especially in downtown Toronto after a Leafs game. The lobby is bright and attractive in a Euro sort of way, and the checkin staff were friendly and helpful and remembered my name (when I locked myself out!) parking was $25 for over a day. The room decor was uninspired but the rooms were a decent size, which is a close 2nd in importance to quiet. The fitness centre wasn't snazzy but the equipment was new and everything seemed well-maintained. The pool was clean and serene, if a bit older. Sunday brunch seemed pricey at $17, but kids under 16 eat free and with two young teens in my group it was a bargain. The only downside to the hotel is the construction in the area which made it a little harder to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice sized rooms - pricey breakfast as usual!”
Reviews.Author: Steph_260
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel on business last month. I had never stayed at a Novotel before, so was a bit apprehensive. However, I found that the room was lovely (large queen size bed with luxury linens), with plenty of floor-space. Staff were polite, and the location was fantastic (check out Scotland Yard, a pub opposite for a nice pint before bedtime!). Only 'gripes' would be that the breakfast was extremely pricey (look at $20 on average), and the television in the room was clearly from the 1990's (no flat screen TV's here!!). I would stay there again - if the price was below $120 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: GrayingAdventurer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Novotel for an overnight Toronto get-away in February 2012. We purchased the room via Hotwire, where it was rated three and one-half stars. I don't remember the exact price, but I think it was about 80 dollars plus all the fees Hotwire adds on. Plus parking, of course. Good value, we thought, and easily worth three and one-half stars. We were in town to attend an event, so we did not have a chance to eat or drink or work out at the hotel. But the Lobby had a nice ambience and the room itself was very nice. (I didn't sense that we had been given a room near the garbage chute because we booked on Hotwire!) The parking, though the normal outrageous rate (25ish) was easy to get to and easy to return from, and much simpler than nearby pay parking options. There is construction going on our front, but this didn't have an impact on us. There are lots of neat places to eat nearby, and it is close to one of the big Toronto theatres (sorry,memory fails me). It is also close to Union Station and to the financial district. And St. Lawrence market, which is always fun to visit (mostly food of many varieties), is just down the street. We would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Toronto hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gary699
Reviews.Content: I visit Toronto on business three or four times a year and learned the hard way to always stay at the Novotel. I don't know how vacationing visitors would feel, but it absolutely rocks for business travel as the hotel really seems to cater to that sort of traveler. The spa and health centre are first rate and, of course, the location can not be beat. The rooms are nice, not special, but neither disapointing. And the restaurant in the hotel is surprisingly good. I recommend this hotel every chance I get.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Love2travelGuelph
Reviews.Content: After checking numerous hotels and scouring Trip Advisor reviews I settled on the Novotel Hotel in Toronto for a one night stay. Where to begin?... Bad location - entire street in front of the hotel is under construction. We were awoken at 2am with the sound of a back hoe right out side our window. This went on until 5am. We were unable adjust the temperature in the room. The thermostat read 16 degrees, but it was about 28 degrees. Bad mattress, no feather pillows or neck pillows available to guests. I was shocked to see a 25 inch screen television perched on the console. No flat screen here! And the lighting was dreadful. The room was overall very dreary and not a place you would like to spend any more time than necessary. Carpets needed a good vacuum. Must I say more!. I feel duped and disappointed by both their web site and my fellow Trip Advisor reviewers - you let me down. I complained to management and have yet to hear back from them.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: SullafaK
Reviews.Content: This was a hotel we got from bidding on priceline so we got a pretty good deal. Parking is > $20/day and we did not have breakfast included in our rate. Everything was within walking distance or a short cab ride. Breakfast was not that good the one time we had it, you're better off eating out in nearby places. St. Lawrence Market is very close for breakfast or lunch. Also very close by was Le Petit Dejeuner where we enjoyed an excellent brunch. My husband enjoyed the pool and hot tub. The staff also recommended Guu, a really good Japanese restaurant that we were impressed with. Koreatown/Chinatown are also within walking distance. There is free wireless in the hotel as well. We will stay again if in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good staff”
Reviews.Author: realtorav8tor
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable and clean and the front desk staff was friendly. Smooth check-in and parking on site was convenient.There are lots of good restaurants nearby within walking distance. A flat screen TV would of been nice. A small store is next to the hotel for some snacks. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but very thin walls”
Reviews.Author: KIm V
Reviews.Content: We were recently in Toronto to go to a Leafs game and then the Monster Truck show at the Rogers Centre the next day. The Novotel was very convenient to both the ACC and the Rogers Cente and many other Toronto tourist attractions. The parking garage was very easy to enter/exit and the $23 charge was very reasonable for downtown Toronto. The lobby was small but nice and the front desk staff were very friendly. Our room was clean and comfortable but we did notice that we could hear everything going on in the hall and in the adjoining rooms through the walls. During the day this wasn't too bad but in the middle of the night when people were coming back from their evenings out, it was pretty loud and woke us up. The hotel is only 8 floors and surrounded by many taller buildings so there really isn't a view from the rooms. Currently there is construction going on right outside the building but it didn't really bother us. There are a few very nice restaurants/pubs right across the street and a few more just 1 block away. I would probably stay here again because of the price, cleanliness and the proximity to many Toronto attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great sleep”
Reviews.Author: JML2011
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy parking lot and a wonderful sleep! Love the duvets! Had a martini in the lounge and was pleasantly surprised at the reasonable price. Fantastic service in the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrpremji
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good and the rooms are clean and decent. But the walls are paper thin and there is too much noise at this hotel. If you are ok with the house keeping people talking loudly and doors banging loudly and random violins playing then stay at this hotel. Otherwise, I would pick something different.

Reviews.Title: “Took MONEY from me! DO NOT STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: jessica a
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel, i was going on a budget. i didnt have a credit card therefore when i called they said i could put a 100$ deposit (expecting to get that money back i agreed) well when i got there the hotel had jumped up in price, also the parking that i asked to be included in the total was not anymore. My deposit was at 95$ when i checked in, so they were taking off money from my deposit before i even went into the room. Let's just say before i left I was more or less owing them money, i did not receive my deposit back and a room that shouldve cost 200 cost me oveer 300$!! DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL!!

Reviews.Title: “Lured by the great price....”
Reviews.Author: bellasusanna
Reviews.Content: Finding a place in Toronto to stay overnight on NYE that wouldn't break the bank looked to be a formidable task. And once we booked the Novotel I began to wonder 'why' it was relatively reasonable on such a big night. We booked two rooms...one for a party coming from Ottawa and another for ourselves who live close to the City.First encounter with the check-in staff was pleasant and helpful.The lobby's decor was somewhat off-putting and rather cheap looking but no matter as we wouldn't be sleeping there. The hallways could use some updating and so my heart was in my mouth when we unlocked the door.The room was nicely appointed,spacious enough and the bed, very comfortable....we had a coffee pot and a frig at our disposal. The location was perfect for our evening plans and close to Union Station for our guests who were travelling by train. A very pleasant surprise and a very pleasant stay. We would definitely stay there again based on what we all thought was very good value

Reviews.Title: “A Great NYE”
Reviews.Author: mvdk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Toronto for New Years. I must say, the thing that makes this hotel amazing is the location. It is very close to great restaurants but was also close to our destination for the night. Because it was so mild we just walked there and back so no need to wait and pay for cabs. For New Years Eve, we got an amazing price. Much better than most hotels on a normal weekend. The hotel is beautifully decorated, especially for the holidays. There is a spot to go on the internet for 20 minutes if you like and lots of places to sit. The thing is, the sitting was what we did a lot of because our room wasn't ready until well past 3 pm. I understand it was busy for NYE but we ended up having to change our reservation to get a room at a faster time. We had traveled all day to get to Toronto so we really wanted to rest up. The staff were busy but never unkind or unfriendly. They let us put our bags in a back room while we had lunch. There were many other young groups like our own at this hotel. Some older couples and groups but most were in their early - mid twenties. The rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was a great size, lots of room to get ready. With a mirror on the wall by the front door, you could have one person in the bathroom and 3 people getting ready in the room. All around great stay, comfortable and clean. Only 'complaint' is that the TV has not been updated to flat screen. But really what did it matter to us? It was New Years!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: MariaVale12
Reviews.Content: Very nice and well located hotel. The rooms are spacious, clean and with free wifi. Extremely confortable bed. Big and clean bathrooms. The restaurant was a very nice surprise. Beautiful decor, wonderful staff and very good food. Great breakfast also. Very good service in every department, from the front desk to the housekeeping. My daughter had a great time in the swimming pool. Very relaxing after a day walking around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to say”
Reviews.Author: MandySue_86
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, room was nice & big ! We were able to walk just about everywhere , if not the hop on hop off bus stop was right out the front ! Friendly helpful staff & the buffet breakfast was yummy !!

Reviews.Title: “An enchanting stay”
Reviews.Author: LiolaB831
Reviews.Content: I was greeted at the front desk as if I was royalty. The Guest Representatives were courteous & quite accommodating. The rooms were clean, the beds were exceptionally nice for a good nights sleep. Housekeeping staff was every bit as professional & accommodating as the rest of the staff I encountered. I spent five nights at this hotel & was every bit as pleased with the service and quality as the first night. The hotel is within walking distance to the extremity of Toronto if you're willing to take it on, as I did. I raved about the location & would go back to stay at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: AmblesideInn-Host
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment our stay at Novotel was, this time. Novotel has been our hotel of choice, when visiting Toronto over the past 10 years. This was our second stay on a New Year's Eve but may well be our last. The hotel is conveniently located, although there is a great deal of construction around the hotel right now. The rooms are comfortable, with good quality matresses, pillows and bed linens. Unfortunately, on this stay there was a hockey tournament in Toronto. We had to contend with a floor full of 17 year olds running up and down the halls, cursing and swearing and throwing things at each other until 4am. Calls to the front desk did nothing to remedy the problem. The front desk staff were full of apologies and sent up security but once security left the floor, mayhem reigned, again. Apparently, the hotel was full so they couldn't even move us to another room. We made our reservation back in mid-October. No mention was made, at that time, that the hotel would be full of teen hockey teams. No effort was made to supervise these young guests and no security measures appear to have been in place to handle the situation. It also appears that no one had the good sense to block rooms on separate floors for the teen guests and those of us who wanted to enjoy a New Years Eve get-away. This stay fell way short of the standard we have come to enjoy at Novotel. How unfortunate!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Concerts, Hockey etc...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very good for proximity to the Air Canada Centre and other venues. Friendly staff.I always go there when staying in Toronto. You have everythingyou need on site. My kids loved the attention they got from the friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place downtown”
Reviews.Author: kimpete8
Reviews.Content: The Novotel is a nice modern hotel in the heart of downtown Toronto. It has spacious rooms, comfortable beds, and a really excellent breakfast buffet. Service was very good, and the price was better than most comparable properties, though there are other less expensive properties to be found with a little searching.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Design Fresh Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: JamesPharm
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via a Price Line bid and I was eager to try it out for the first time. I enjoyed the modern design of the hotel and found the lobby quite aesthetically pleasing. The courtesy desk staff were friendly and accommodating. I was given a basic room that was both tidy and well maintained. The modern design lacks luxury but the room did meet my needs. I phoned ahead to let the hotel know it was my birthday and I feel that I did not receive any special recognition for the occasion (other hotels often upgrade or send a bottle of wine for example). Bottom line, I would return to this hotel in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and good value... poor reservations and check in procedures.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice renovations and amenities. The rooms are a little dated but the bedding/linens are great. Free wireless and decent gym/pool facilities make this a great value priced hotel right in the heart of Toronto. The street is also very quiet - considering the number of pubs and restaurants it the neighborhood. The staff is very friendly and professional, ALTHOUGH, the reservation accuracy is horrible. I've stayed in the hotel 5 times and my reservations have been mixed up every time - for the price and location its certainly worth the wait. Make sure you get clarification if your breakfast is included in your room rate - this gets mixed up as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good value in the heart of downtown Toronto. Walking distance to shops, subway and offices, and especially the underground city. Decent size rooms. Very comfortable. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anikabella
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for a weekend in Toronto. The location is excellent. You have access to public transportation and are withint walking distance to many major attraction. We went to the Air Canada Centre one evening and this was at a short distance of walk. The check-in/check-out was easy and convenient and the underground parking easily accessible. The room was specious with a TV, King sized bed and a nice bathroom. We haven't used any of the common areas, so I can't comment on those but I know there is a gym and a pool available.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service - They charged me for a cancelled room”
Reviews.Author: NilushaL
Reviews.Content: Re: the Downtown Toronto, Ontario (Canada) location, the customer service is absolutely ridiculous and the record keeping system seems to be non-existent. I've been charged for a stay that was cancelled more than a month in advance (and, even at that time, I was put through far more hassle for the cancellation than I should have been, and it all boiled down to a mistake that was on the hotel's part). The manager I've been speaking with hasn't even attempted to apologize for the inconvenience and her attitude is horrible. There seems to be no communication system between the people who work at the centralized/toll-free booking # and those who work at the actual hotel, therefore the left hand has no idea what the right is doing. Not only that, but the attitudes of the management are abhorrent. The hotel may be nice, but be careful if there's a chance that you'd have to cancel your reservation; you might have to pay for their incompetence, literally.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Value in Central Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Dalry
Reviews.Content: Excellent rates and comfort in this downtown hotel. The breakfast buffet was superb value--and there's a substantial early-bird discount if you eat before 8 am. Cocktail prices are very reasonable, too, and the wait staff in the restaurant and bar were very attentive. The guestrooms are large and quiet and have good bathroom amenities. There is no harbour view (our room looked into a parking garage), but the proximity of good restaurants and easy walking distance to shops make this an excellent location for a city break. Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “nice room, good location”
Reviews.Author: LLPCanada
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed overnight while attending an event at the CNER grounds. The Novotel was conveniently located, with easy access to Lakeshore and the south end of the city. We booked through Priceline, and had no problems at check in. The room was nice, clean, roomy enough for eating at the room service table. The room service menu was very similar to the menu in the restaurant downstairs, and very close in price. Room service was prompt and polite, and the food was nice and hot when it arrived. I should probably note that the hotel did not seem busy - no conferences or meetings going on while we were there. Two things that were a bit tricky - they have those pressure sensitive mini-bar in the rooms - my mom put a couple of things into it and we had to go to the front desk to get charges removed, but that was handled fairly easily. I find a fridge much more helpful than a min-bar. Also, the parking is not well marked and we drove in circles looking for the proper hotel parking. It was $25 for 24 hours - we probably could have parked for less at the covered Green P lot a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, Old, Bad Service - Nothing Good About This Place!”
Reviews.Author: AussieMelb2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights because I'm an Accor Platinum member. Firstly, the hotel room we were checked-into was very bad. It was probably the crappiest room in the hotel. When we checked-in, we asked if we were upgraded because of our membership status and was told that that has been taken care of. However when we got to the room, it was small, old, didn't look clean and definitely wasn't what we've expected. The room definitely wasn't as what was described even as a standard room on the hotel's website. There was no magnifying mirror, no sofa bed, no flat sheet on bed. It looked like a 1* motel room - worse than a private room in a hostel! furniture was cheap, Ikea-like ones. We rang front desk and spoke to another guy. There were rooms we could have been upgraded to but they weren't doing that because we had our lil' dog with us. Well, that wasn't stated on the A-Club membership that you can only get upgraded if there are rooms available and you are without a pet! Walls were also very thin and not sound proof. very noisy. bunch of guests partying in room next to ours for two nights It was super hot in bedroom eventhough the aircond was on 15 degree celcius. I sweat all night and couldn't sleep. Told front desk in the morning before going out. We were advised rudely that nothing can be done. It was because the heating in the entire building was turned on. Was that really true? The corridor was nice and cool. He said he'll speak to engineering but nothing was done. We returned six hours later room was very hot and stuffy. Called front desk and this time the lady sent a maintenance guy up and he felt the heat too and offered us a fan. Fan was much better but was loud and noisy! I had to sleep with my ear plugs on! TV was an old, crappy box! No HD whatsover. In this day and age, do we still use such TVs in a hotel? We also tried to use the printer in the lobby! There was no ink and we got one of the staff member to fix it. All he did was shake the toner and said it'll be fine. Well, it wasn't. We returned to the front desk and spoke to another lady but her answer was she didn't know how to fix it and will get the other guy to do it when he returns. Well, shouldn't the front desk staff know how to fix something so basic? We didn't receive any vouchers for any welcome drinks either like we did in other Accor hotels...Instead, we received a fine for not displaying our parking ticket! Er...we told the hotel at check-in that we had a car and we were charged $23/night for parking! We had to ring the hotel after we got back into the US (because the fine wasn't displayed on the windscreen and somehow flew onto the front as we were driving). We were advised that we had to fax the fine through to them and they'll fix it. Come on! We had to spend $$ on the phone call and fax when they could have easily given us a pass or something to put on our dashboard? Come on! This place was definitely not worth the CAN190/night (approximately). We won't be staying here again and neither would we recommend it to anyone. In fact, we probably won't be staying at any Novotel hotels again! EXPENSIVE, BAD SERVICE and CRAPPY ROOMS!

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Hotel - Nice for Work or Play”
Reviews.Author: bamboostar
Reviews.Content: The particular room I stayed in was clean and met my expectations for the price paid. While it wasn't the most glamorous of rooms, the King size bed was very comfortable and outfitted with good quality sheets. The iPod dock/alarm clock was convenient and worked well to get me up in the early morning after a late night. The bathroom was spacious and well-appointed, which is more than I can say about many other generic business hotels. As a woman with too many toiletries and cosmetics, the extra counter space and room to maneuver was a bonus. While I am a local Torontonian and generally don't need to stay in hotels in my home city, I have experienced a few and would recommend this location to visitors to Toronto for business or tourist reasons for the location alone. The hotel is very close to the financial district for business meetings and is also adjacent to some nice neighbourhoods including Old Toronto by St. Lawrence Market and the Distillery District. The Eaton Centre, theatres and other entertainment are also within walking distance. A few other family members also booked rooms for the same night and we enjoyed a nice breakfast in the lobby restaurant. If you manage to get a rate that includes breakfast, you will be pleasantly surprised by the stellar service and good food. Novotel has a mild French flair so my relatives from Montreal appreciated the quality baked goods at breakfast. I normally dread hotel breakfast buffets, but Novotel's offerings impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Not even worth the deal rate”
Reviews.Author: Parrys
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Toronto after our daughter's wedding in Toronto. Because we booked a deal rate of about 150.00/ night we got an old room that was very tight with regard to space and very old and tired. Extensions cords that didn't work - including under the fitted carpet. The BR was moldy. Towels weren't great. Ambiance was like a cheap motel. The location is great and I know it costs a lot to stay downtown but this really felt like and 80 dollar room. My recommendation either get a newly renovated room or stay out closer to the airport where there is lots of choice and much better value. Staff at the front desk were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chyla1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while attending a business conference. The rooms were decent tho I didnt spend much time in them. Other attendees did have issues with the shower head sliding down and cold water but I didnt. Breakfast was served for our conference the first day which was very good. Lunch I wasnt much a fan of but it got rave reviews from others. Across the street is a strip of bars and though we didnt hear anything other attendees say they heard fighting and what not. Lounge in hotel is only open until 12pm.

Reviews.Title: “Location trumps all”
Reviews.Author: Ironwoodtrail
Reviews.Content: Great downtown location within easy walking distance of theatres, restaurants, pubs and the new distillery district which is a marvelous transformation of the old distillery warehouses just east of the downtown core. The St. Lawrence market is a two block walk and well worth the visit expecially on Saturday morning. Lots of construction going on on The Esplanade which is a bit of a nuisance, but it's all for the good! Nicely appointed room, not large but ok. No flat screen TV's yet which was disappointing. One thing to watch for....the mini bar, bottled water and snack items are on pressure sensitivie pads. If you just lift them to read the label, it registeres a charge to ;your room. Don't touch anything you don't want to pay for. The coffee maker is free though!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: blabla96
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel for 3 nights. This hotel is close to shopping and sightseeing. The room was clean and for a downtown hotel quite spacious. They have a very good breakfast buffet, best bread I've ever eaten in Canada. What was a little annoying was a fire alarm at 2 a.m. one night. We were standing outside for almost an hour and nobody of the staff did talk to us. It was a false alarm but I would expect from hotel staff that they at least let the guests know what is going on.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent values”
Reviews.Author: PattyDSask
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days while visiting family in Toronto during a record heat wave when the humidex hit 50 degrees celsius. The hotel was comfortable and perfectly located. Easy access to St. Lawrence Market, the theatre district, Rogers Stadium, and some great restaurants (including a nice option right in the hotel). If you're looking for luxuries this is not the place, but for great value in an unbeatable location, this is a really good option.

Reviews.Title: “Last time...”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm L
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Novotel Toronto numerous times as we enjoy what the Esplanade offers with the pubs right across the street, the short walk up to Front as well as the Distillery District not being too far away. The Novotel was a basic Hotel at a reasonable price in a great location, That however has changed. During our recent stay on 2011/10/28 we ended up paying $169 plus taxes with parking an additional $23......that my friends means Novotel is no longer a good bang for the buck. The lobby has been re-done in neon blue and white with the check-in counters being small one person podiums where I was initially unsure if I was to check in or buy a calling card. The walls are done in faux Insane Asylum padding for some reason, perhaps because paying $200.00 all in for a night there is crazy. The rooms are still exactly the same with the Novotel continuing to be one of the few Hotel hold outs refusing to put flat screens in the rooms. So the search is on for a replacement Hotel for weekends in T.O.

Reviews.Title: “My Regular (Once Per Year) Toronto Haunt”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've been travelling on business for a week to Toronto once per year for the last 11 years. Every time I have taken the trip, I have stayed at the Novotel. Over that time a number of renovations and facelifts have taken place but nothing to detract from the quality / character of the place. Spacious, clean and well appointed rooms. Good gym and pool, good food and drink, ultra convenient location and all backed with the customary Accor ethos which makes me a regular user of most of their brands. Staff all excellent and a credit to the place. I have colleagues who have stayed in various other Toronto downtown hotels, few ever seem to be as satisfied as me with their accommodation. Reliable, clean, high quality and friendly hotel that makes business travel far less of a chore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel near CN Tower and other attractions”
Reviews.Author: Satella
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel at a very special price on Price line. The Hotel is very impressive. I really like the automatic opening doors at the front of reception. Reception desk wasn't so nice. I requested for a 2 beds no smoking prior to arriving and was told it was ok. Upon arrival the clerk didn't recognize it and told me they had king bed and she could upgrade me to a king bed with a sofa bed which i accepted. The #1 thing i hate about this hotel is the accessing of the elevators!! You need to always push your hotel key-card in the slot so the elevator could operate. It is a nice security feature if you are going in and out once but if your moving in and out several times it turns into a hassle! Upon getting to my floor the smell of cleaning detergent was very strong!! Too clean of a smell in the hallways. Quickly rushed to the room to avoid the smell of too clean!! Upon checking in my room. I really liked the layout, The Washroom was HUGE!! Big rectangular mirror and shower was impressive. King bed was nice and comfy same with the sofabed. Flat screen TV is nice! Also a small mini bar was there no idea how long the food was there though so i just left it. The view wasn't appealing as we got the parking lot. Luckily it wasn't loud at night! The swimming pool is very small but accommodating to singles and couples. If there are kids then it gets too loud. I really like the Jacuzzi pool. Fitness room was spacious and had all your equipment needed to work out. Overall a good hotel to stay at. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “ok but not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: DaveNLouise
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop on a long holiday across multiple locations before going home, we booked the Novotel on the recommendations of friends and when all said and done the hotel is more than adequate and reasonable. Everything you'd expect from a city hotel providing services to business users is available, the rooms are comfortable with reasonable shows and bath, coffee making facilites, mini bar etc. Being in the city its short distance to most places you'll want to frequent with plenty of local bars and restuarants just over the road. Sadly thats all there is to say about the hotel, it came across somewhat bland with little minor niggles which left us feeling a little soured, none of them major but when combined we gave this the lowest rating of the 5 or 6 hotels we stayed at during our break. Small niggles - There was construction going on outside in the street. As it turned out our suites were directly opposite the construction (15-20ft away). Luckily for the first couple of days it was over thanksgiving so the construction wasn't operating however on the last day of our stay we were awoken at 7am to the annoying constant beeping of reversing JCB's and revving heavy engines etc etc. Although these things happen it would have been good to have had the option when we first checked in to be warned about this and maybe an offer of a room further away from the works - Internet access was flakey, the wireless signal was solid but throughout our stay whether you got any throughput was extremely variable - Hotel unable to organise hire cars, when we enquired we were told there was lots of local companies but if the hotel was on the ball you would have expected them to offer to organise it for you or at least give you a map with all the local options and maybe some recommendations. - We had a fire alarm and evacuation at 1:30am, again, these things happen, however we all trundled outside onto the street, watched the fire engines come and go and generally loitered for half an hour. At no point was a member of staff visible or anything communicated other than the automated alarm. After half an hour we decided to go back into the hotel as no-one had told anyone what was happening or whether it was safe to go back inside (we came to the decision that anything seriously burning would have generated some visible smoke by that time). - Housekeeping kept forgetting to replenish the sugar and other coffee materials which again is minor but aggravating when you don't notice it until the morning when you need your coffee

Reviews.Title: “Room 444 - quiet and comfortable king”
Reviews.Author: wernickejc
Reviews.Content: The convention accomodations team booked me here so I wasn't sure what to expect. I usually like a high floor when inside a city but this hotel only has the lower 6 floors and the side of the building I was booked on is alongside the railroad. There was construction taking place on the opposite (street) side but as it turned out the east end of the hotel is far enough away from the tracks that you couldn't hear the trains. And while there is a parking garage near by, it was not a problem with noise. When I first checked in I asked to be moved away from the tracks but the clerk was thoughtful enough to point out the construction and told me I would like the room. I did. The hotel location is very good although not ideal for the convention centre which si about 4 city blocks away. However, it is not that long a walk and you can get across via the skywalk from Union Station which is just 2 blocks away. What was really nice was it close proximity to the St. Lawrence Market and the Distillery District as well as Yonge Street.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: cantravel00
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is superb, near the fabulous St. Lawrence Market and the waterfront. My room was an average size, clean, and comfortable. Nothing fancy, but perfectly acceptable. The rooms and hallways are probably ready to be refreshed in terms of decor but still in good condition. The lobby is gorgeous. My room was quiet, and I had a comfortable sleep. Overall, it was a good value for the price, and I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for a short stay in Toronto.”
Reviews.Author: petsaloz
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in transit to other parts of Canada. It was very convenient to Union Station and provided a convenient location to explore the city and sights. With limited time we were able to see most of the key areas of the city. Service was satisfactory - the room was well serviced and extra towels were left as requested. The room was a good size. The restaurant was good and offered a special rate meal of 2 or 3 courses which was excellent value. The wait staff was very good. My only disappointment was the "free" wi-fi. It was terrible and so slow. When I complained the guest services passed it on to engineering who called back promptly. Problem was they could give me a help line number and then it was my problem. I would rather pay than have this poor service free.

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: nezzilla
Reviews.Content: I really liked the location of this hotel, everything seemed close, considering that Toronto is such a big city. I did not have breakfast included, but the room was really big for me (it was an individual one, but it had a double bed plus a sofa which seemed some extra bed). Locker included. The staff was simply ok, not really that kind, but not bad. The building was under reformation. What I did not like was the room service, expensive, and the Internet connection was way too slow.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Canadian Hoping to Soon be a Las Vegas Local
Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Accommodation, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: lv_local_wannabe
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers some good discounts on multi-day stays, and while not extravagant, is a good value for downtown Toronto (we paid $159-$179 / night). It is a 10 minute walk from the Metro Toronto Convention Centre / CN Tower and has a very stylish, remodeled, modern lobby, lounge and restaurant. Unfortunately, the rooms have an 'older' hotel feeling, although the bed was new and comfortable, and the washroom facilities were modern and sufficient. There is a confectionary just outside for drinks and snacks (open until midnight) and a really superb non-standard Keg across the street (far superior to most cookie-cutter Kegs I've been to in the past).

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably well located with basic room”
Reviews.Author: Husky20
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly with the exception of one, breakfast comprehensive, good selection of reasonably priced pubs & restaurants nearby

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: ethalLancashire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights, the reception staff were very helpful and the room was a reasonable size, clean and had everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “SIBOS stay”
Reviews.Author: DavBai
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the banking conference as this was a hotel recommended by the organisers. Rooms were clean and spacious with good wifi connection. The breakfasts were great and the staff were pleasant and friendly with a smile. Convenient enough to get where needed - both eating area and a 15 minute walk to the conference centre (MTCC) and the CN Tower. Overall very comfortable stay

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: this is a good hotel to stay in very central, good access to union square and yunge street. the cn tower is only minutes away.the staff are very friendly especially the breakfast staff whom you could have a good laugh with. the bedrooms are clean and comfy

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: SanoNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here and woke up with lice in my hair!!! Absolutely awful! The room looks nice, clean etc but the beds clearly are not!! I stayed here recently on a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: lemagold
Reviews.Content: I hadn't heard of the Novotel before but since my family and I were attending a concert at the Sony Centre, we decided to book this hotel for its location. The location was perfect, not only for the concert but so much morel It was located within a short walking distance to many attractions. The St Lawrence Market and many good restaurants and pubs are located right outside the door of this fabulous hotel. The room was quite spacious and very clean and comfortable. I was also impressed with the security of this hotel since you couldn't take an elevator to another floor from the Lobby unless your room card was inserted into a security slot first. All staff we came in contact were very welcoming, friendly and helpful. I can't wait for the chance to visit this hotel and this area of Toronto again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Latinhunny33
Reviews.Content: It's not the best there is, but it was nice. Hotel room had lots of space, free internet, comfy bed. It's location is great, short walk from the St Lawrence Market. There's a beer garden next to the hotel & is in close proximity to restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, free upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: aagha
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a package deal. Probably would not have chosen it if booked alone. Beautiful lobby. The person that checked us in at the front desk had an accent that was hard to understand, and he was not very friendly. However, when told that we were on our honeymoon, they did give us a free upgrade to a larger suite. The only downside of the suite is that the shower wall has no curtain and you can see out into the rest of the room, and into the bathroom. Not very private, although if you are there with your spouse/partner, you may not mind? Just found it very odd... We had breakfast late one morning and they did accomodate us although it was past breakfast serving time. Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “it doesn't deserve the money”
Reviews.Author: Samuer J
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Toronto last week and booked two nights in this hotel. The hotel's location is good and near the downtown area. However, we were very disappointed by its service. The hotel setting is outdated. The cleanness is acceptable. But the room floor carpet was very worn and dirty. Actually we found two bed bugs in the night. The most funny thing was that the hotel uses regular shopping cart (normally seen in the grocery store) for customers to carry their luggage. It was very hard for me to put our large luggage into that cart. No free breakfast, not free wi-fi. The internet was so slow that you had to forget about it. No free parking (25 dollars per night), no refrigerator. Actually there is one in your room. However, it was full of beverage cans and snack for sale. They called it "minibar". A small bottle of spring water is 5.5 dallors. It makes you feel like that you pay money for a room, they put a vending machine in it. The indoor pool is not for small kids. It has no shallow area. It is 1.5m deep everywhere. After we stayed in it for one night, we decided to leave. So bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Alex W
Reviews.Content: We found this to be a superb hotel, within walking distance of the CN Tower and the train station. We had a family room (two children, sharing a queen bed) and it was very clean. Very impressed with the breakfast buffet. Be aware that everyone appears to have the same problem with the lift, first time. It is an acutely embarrassing initiation ceremony! You will press the floor number, and the lift will go to a floor that is not the floor you expected. This will keep happening, which I can tell you becomes excruciatingly embarrassing the second time you appear on the lobby in front of everyone else. We were rescued by someone finally getting in with us - put your room card in the barely visible slot next to the lift buttons, and suddenly it goes where you want! I assumed it was just us being stupid, but I watched it happen to every other new guest too. It is very funny to watch, I will admit :-) You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “If I go to toronto again I`ll stay at novotel”
Reviews.Author: steffi239
Reviews.Content: Novotel is so close to all the sights you must see. The CN tower is just blocks away and so is young street and toronto islands. the rooms are big and clean. they have a pool, sauna, a hot tub and gym. Even though we had some trouble to check in the manager came to help us. beautiful city, wonderful hotel. Go and stay there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Guysingle
Reviews.Content: Only stayed two nights here but really appreciated the location and facilities the hotel has to offer. Large clean bedrooms and efficient reception. Would definitely stay here again. Only criticism is being woken up at 3 am by a member of staff who got the wrong room. However mistakes do happen so I didn't let it spoil my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but all a bit tired!”
Reviews.Author: scubaleopard
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent position but sadly for us the reception was undergoing renovation so it was really noisy. The rooms really are a little tired -- although comfortable. The carpet definitely looked grubby! Bathroom on the other hand was good. Very strange attitude to minibar! -- They actually say that it is electronically activated to your bill if you remove any item. You can not store personal food goods in it and when we did they were removed by the chambermaid who only did this but did not service the room!! All a bit odd! When we asked about taxis one was ordered at reception and we had no problem with the service but it was not a metered taxi -- more a kind of family arrangement -! All in all good spot for a couple of days. Within walking distance of CN Tower etc but actually Toronto felt a bit of a building site and this hotel felt tired of it all

Reviews.Title: “Best location for your money”
Reviews.Author: Dumptruck_11
Reviews.Content: My Fiancee and I stayed in this hotel from August 20-27. The rooms are very clean and spacious. The bed is extremely comfortable. What is specious about this hotel is its affordable price and unique location. It lies in the center of most tourist attractions Toronto has to offer and all within walking distance. The annual Buskerfest is held in the St. Lawrence neighborhood and Novotel is located in this area. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again if I visit Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to most activities”
Reviews.Author: scotty016
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location... It is a ten minute walk to the harbour front, which has a great selection of restaurants and bars overlooking Lake Ontario and the Toronto Islands...There is a ferry boat which leaves frequently to one of the Islands, where you will find bike rentals and lots of entertainment for the kids etc. Also you can sail out on to the lake on various boats. Also from this hotel again a short ten minute walk away is one of the main shopping areas Yonge St... There you will find the Eaton's Centre with 100 + shops, and of course lots of places to eat and drink. The hotel is also close to the Rogers centre and the C.N. Tower , also the main rail station Union Station, all of which are also within walking distance. A short taxi ride away will take you to the entertainment district, for live theatre. This hotel is clean and comfortable, I'm sure you would enjoy your stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Spartan but we would probably stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Glzz2
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Toronto Centre is in an ideal location for hopping on the expressway or subway to get to various TO attractions and for walking to the typical tourist spots. The hotel itself was a bit spartan--no pads, pens, fridge or microwave; towels were not fluffy, etc. I also wasn't sure how clean the room was. However, the staff was accommodating, and we got a great rate, so I'd probably stay there again. My son loved the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: earllee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Novotel during the last weekend in July. We had some minor issues but overall a great value in Toronto. We have a family of four and after having a bad experience at another establishment wanted to ensure that the next hotel we chose would be comfortable for a family with small children. Check-in went smoothly. The front desk attendant was not overly friendly but that is a subjective kind of assessment. We did have to change rooms because of an A/C leak in which a section of the carpet became wet. That wasnt that big of a problem. We notified the front desk and we were given another room almost immediately. The rooms were fine for the size- not huge but not tiny. I see that many people complain about the CRT televisions that are present in the standard room, as opposed to a flat panel LCD...you people need to maybe stop watching so much television and step outside of your hotel room once in awhile. Room service although expensive (which is expected) was exceptional. However the attendants sometimes have a hard time comprehending English (???). The pool area was nice and so was the gym. You all need your room card/key to access the hotel elevators and the amenities, which is a nice touch in terms of security. Excellent location if you wish to be downtown. Any place is within walking distance. If you do stay here- DO NOT PARK IN THE HOTEL LOT! The municipal lot on Church St., around the corner, is only $14/day compared to the $25.99/day they will convince you to pay upon check-in. If you have small children they are entitled to a small stuffed animal when you check-in- we had to ask for it (not a big deal). The one and only big negative about Novotel is the mini-bar policy. The minibar has sensors and if you remove any item you will automatically be billed- even if you return it to its original spot! I believe that Novotel needs to revisit this policy because of its complete absurdity. Other than that we had a great stay and would definitely consider staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SueFell
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for a few days and loved it. Lovely rooms, clean and very comfy beds. Free and reliable wifi and safe - something you often have to pay extra for in other hotels. The location was central and many of the tours pick up at the hotel which was handy. The staff were friendly and efficient. One morning I had the room service breakfast and it was wonderful, piping hot, more than enough and perfectly made tea in a pot (the only place in Canada I got good tea!) We also tried both the "Summerlicious" lunch ($15) and dinner ($25) in the restaurant, and they were both delicious and excellent value for money. I would highly recommend this hotel, you get a lot for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect location downtown Toronto. Easy axcess to everything. Nice breakfast, but breakfast should be included in rate:-).xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “Excellent centre for the best of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: wande23412
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located for virtually everything you want to see in the city. It is clean; the rooms are spacious and the breakfast is very good. The staff were very helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room”
Reviews.Author: Baseballzill1
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a really great location for the harbourfront, Yonge Street, the CN tower and, most importantly for me, the Rogers centre, home to the Toronto Blue Jays baseball team. All are within easy walking distance. The standard bedroom was spacious even with the most fabulous comfy, massive bed. The restaurant is light with good staff. The only down side was that there was often only one person behind reception which leads to a bit of queing but i would recommend this hotel. Good times.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: jjamccro
Reviews.Content: Very happy with our 4 day stay at this hotel. The room was clean and well apointed and all staff encountered were friendly and helpful. Although we faced the back of the hotel we didn't hear any train noise. There are plenty of restaurants and a grocery store nearby. if you are new to the area the Big Yellow Tour Bus has a stop just outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice but a bit pricey.”
Reviews.Author: tbrider28
Reviews.Content: Chose to stay here as it was the closest hotel to the event we were in Toronto for. Checkin is 3pm but our flight was early morning and they allowed us to check in by 10am no problem. Paying $25 to park was a bit excessive. There was cheaper city parking near by and we will use that next time. The pool was nice but could use a clean and the same bits of rubbish were there for several days. The gym was excellent and the equipment was not outdated like some hotels. The bar did not provide a large drink menu and was unable to make several mixed drinks we requested. There are some fabulous pubs and resturants right across the street and we went there for drinks instead. The resturant looked nice but was a bit confusing. Brunch not that great for the price. We got to the resturant at 10:45 and staff did not serve us until 11, and the buffet was on until 11. Instead of allowing us to wait and order off the lunch menu they told us they had kept the buffet open past 11 just for us. I would have preferred the lunch menu but not an option. Wait staff was polite but did not ever check in and took a while to get our orders. The room was nice, the bed very comfortable but the AC made a noise of continous running water. We did not bother to complain but the noise didn't go away at all. The bathrooms could use an upgrade and the TV was quite old. Overall we would stay there again because not because of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapoInted”
Reviews.Author: Giros652
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old and run down... Our 'upgraded' room had a plugged toilet, a roof caving in, a half eaten/re-tied bag of cashews in the bar fridge, no sheets on the bed... And apparently no manager on staff to deal with the issues.. We basically got trapped in a dump. Would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonably priced hotel in the heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: TTARRY
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the start of a three week vacation in Canada (Toronto, Niagara, Montreal, The Rockies etc...). I chose it partly because it was affordable and at the same time convenient for the main train station for our day trip to Niagara and onward travel to Montreal. First sight wasn't too inspiring, down a quiet street with work going on at the station end of it. In fact the location was fine, and convenient both for the downtown district and other heritage areas of the city. I worried whether it was too close to the train lines, but we were never disturbed by noise. I'd stay there if I was ever in Toronto again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay during SADE concert”
Reviews.Author: TheSuiteLifeNewYork
Reviews.Content: Aside from a minor mini bar hiccup, which was quickly corrected our stay was pleasant and worth every penny! The rooms was clean and served the purpose, sleep & rest prior and after the Sade concert. Also, there are several eating experiences within walking distance in addition to a grocery store!! The hotel converts currency and the breakfast buffet was to die for! I wish the USD went further..lol

Reviews.Title: “Don't book if you are looking to sleep well- paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: lbp1961
Reviews.Content: Our room was one that is sometimes use by families ( meaning that there was a communicating door between two rooms) problem is that we were not with anybody we know. The door between the two rooms were unlocked. A big security issue... There was pee on the bathroom stall and that means that the bathroom was not cleaned properly between guest. A big problem for us. And the most annoying thing was that we could hear everything from the other room and from people in the corridor. Couldn't fall asleep before 10h pm. We were very disapointed by this hotel and we will never use again.

Reviews.Title: “Location good, room not so great”
Reviews.Author: JaniceNJ66
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Novotel Toronto Centre at 2 pm -- an hour before the 3 pm check-in time. However, the woman at the front desk took my name, credit card info, and within minutes (and without much conversation) we were checked in. Unfortunately, the room was not the 2-queen room we had booked online (directly with Novotel); it was a 1-queen, daybed/trundle room. We schlepped our stuff back down to the lobby and the same check-in woman said, "Well, that's what they booked you into". (I'm really not sure who "they" were.) We were then told we could either keep that room or vacate the room till sometime after 3 pm, but she couldn't guarantee when a 2-queen room would be available. We ended up keeping the room (the daybed/trundle worked ok for our two kids), but it started us off on a sour note. The front desk clerk gave us no info about the hotel (pool on the 8th floor, kids eat free etc.) and there was also no hotel information in the room. The room itself was disappointing. The window was small by hotel standards, and the north-facing view resulted in poor natural light. The decor seemed tired -- drab brown and tan and the room lighting was sub-par, giving the room a gloomy quality. There was a mini-fridge but it's only to be used as a mini-bar; there's no room for one's own stuff. The bathroom was clean. The pool was fine. Parking was "only" $22/day, which is lower than many other Toronto hotels. The hotel was generally ok, but I probably wouldn't stay here again. It just didn't have a friendly, guest-oriented feel to it.

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS.....Internet”
Reviews.Author: Batman1616
Reviews.Content: the 1st nite i had 1 bite, which i had no idea what it was. the 2nd nite i had several, 15-20 bites i didnt know what they were , i showed them to a colleague who told me they were bedbug bites i confirmed it via the internet, still get itchy thinkin about it. i called the front desk, told them i had bedbugs and was asked if i had been bitten I said yes and was told he would bring a key for another room. management later said this was the 1st incident. im not so sure, they have a policy to throw out the mattress and fumigate the ajacent rooms, hmmm why do they need a policy if this was the 1st occurence. Internet was slower than dialup.....very poor

Reviews.Title: “Nice, a bit older hotel but still nice”
Reviews.Author: stillsmoking
Reviews.Content: Got the room for $210 US for 2 nights, June 3rd and 4th from Hotwire as a eastside downtown 4 star hotel. Is it 4 stars, not from AAA but its a strong 3 1/2 I feel. The staff was great. Front desk check in went fine, I did get stuck with one king bed, rather have 2 full or queen beds and do get them even if I book off hotwire. Most times you get a bit larger room but when she confirm I was checking in alone, said something like its all i need..well what is how she acted it seemed. My room size was OK and the window very small but it opened. The crank handle did nothing but you can just push it open if you unlock it. Nice, had a screen also. Made the room more freshing and the next morning it poured rain for a few hours before clearing up. No rain came inside cause the window was tuck under the roof and it was raining very hard for hours. The A/C was about useless but the temps were cool for the most part, really didn't need it. Thought the room was very clean, Oh yeah, the hotel keeps the flat bed sheet that goes under the cover in the closet..why I don't know. Thanks to another reviewer, I knew right where to find it, so no need to call house keeping. Was easy to do but here I am re making my bed up while on holiday, a first ! The bathroom was OK, not really fancy but pretty nice, If I paid $200 a night I would had been displeased. I noticed later Friday night--say 3am? no hot water, just warm at the most. Hotel was busy and I guess they ran low cause the next morning around 9am the water was very hot. Never noticed it again but then didn't try late Sat night. The TV was the old style tube type, just like I still have at my home, thought it worked just fine. Sure the flat TV's are nicer and I'm sure the hotel will be changing them pretty soon. The bed is more important I feel and that was great. During the rainstorm I mostly stayed in my room till after 2 pm. There is one store near by and its in a cover walk way so I did not even get wet. Got the newspaper and some snacks and went back to relax and watch TV. Had the do not disturb sign on my door. I could hear the maids going around but not one knock, even lightly on my door. Nice, sometimes--many times for me, if the maids around and seen you up earlier that morning they still knock and ask of the can clean the room now when they pass by. . This hotel staff was great, the maids were there but just out of the way. Never really seen them and didn't say a word to them. Left my room finally around 2:30 pm and got back before 5 pm and my room was clean and the maid carts long gone. Might not sound like much but not being disturb is nice when many times for me the maids seem to think no harm in knocking. Left my room key in my room once--almost never do that but I just got back to my room and decided to use the pay phone in the lobby and quickly left my room. Front staff was great, 30 seconds later had a new room key--I did have my ID on me...the clerk didn't seem bother one bit to make up a new key up. The elevators you do need to use your room key to go up, not down. No biggie and that is how I recalled I left my room key, so nice in a way. If you do have a guest over and they don't have a room key, you do have to go down to the lobby and bring them up the elevator to your room, only drawback. Elevators did always work fast, under a min it be there and I was on the 7th floor. On the lobby floor i think the doors open as soon as you pushed the button for it..almost every time. Would stay at the hotel again for the price I paid, even a bit more Did ask how much for one more night, got told they can't match hotwire and June 5th would be $199 plus tax, I checkout instead. I would had stayed another night if it would had been under $140. Hotwire price before fees was $87 US a night, I don't understand hotel pricing, hotwire likely paid around $170 for both nights. Don;t think the hotel was sold out of even close, did not seem really busy Sun morning. The location isn't bad, just a bit of a walk to a subway station. Very safe location and felt conformable walking around anytime night or day.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Ynysforgan_Jack
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for seven nights in June 2011 and was very impressed. Check in was quick and the rooms were clean on arrival and everything in order. The room facilities were good with a large TV, ironing board and lots of information about the local area. The rooms were cleaned everyday to a very high standard The hotel has a good bar which gives complimentary nibbles with your drinks. The staff were top class and helped with enquiries about attractions in the area and how to get there. The location is also central to everything in the Toronto area. The only small negatives, wifi was very slow and the minibars in the room very expensive. If i was visiting Toronto again I would definitely stay return. .

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: selgie
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here. I booked this hotel through Expedia and had some stress checking in as they had NO evidence of my reservation. I can't place the blame on them; it was Expedia's bad. They were able to find the reservation and we were in our way in short order. Room was really nice. We had dinner in the restaurant and the waiter was amazing. So friendly and playful with my son. Very nice time. The only down side was the parking garage...it wasn;t totally clear if I needed to get a ticket or not. I now know that you just park and go into the lobby. HARD to turn out of the driveway...very bad blind spots so be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: pyctravellingman
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in late May/early June 2011. The hotel is centrally located and is within easy walking distance to the subway, the financial district, many tourist attractions and numerous restaurants and bars. I have noticed a number of recent reviews complaining about the size of the rooms and windows and the internet. I found my room to be very spacious, comfortable and clean and the window was very large (although I did face a multi-story car park). I had no difficulty with the free internet access. I booked my room on the hotel's website for C$150 per night including taxes which I thought was excellent value for Toronto, particularly given the central location. I did not eat at the hotel as there were numerous choices in the area from cheap and cheerful to upmarket. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The employees were professional, the beds were very comfortable, and the room was clean and spacious. The only thing I can complain about was the mini- shampoo and shower gel provided by the room. The square bottles with the square caps were impossible to open with wet hands - which, of course, you don't discover until you're already in the shower and your hands are wet. I even tried prying the cap off with my nails and couldn't do it. I had to dry my hands off in order to open them up. The same thing happened the next day - it wasn't just a fluke or extra-hard because it was the first time I was opening the bottles.

Reviews.Title: “Nooooo more Novotel for me”
Reviews.Author: Silverain54
Reviews.Content: Bottom line - we didn't like the Novotel. Can't pinpoint too much of what we didn't like I get its a boutique stye hotel but the rooms were very small compared to other downtown Toronto hotels in the same price range. The rooms were very very clean so no issues there. The location is very cool... across from a bunch of restaurants and you can see the St. Lawrence Market down the street, and there's a Sobey's a few block away. To use the elevator you had to use your key card, if I was a solo female traveler this would have been a nice feature. But nobody told us how to work it and we ended up riding the elevator for a bit. I would probably say the small rooms, no fridge, and teeny tiny windows made you feel like you were staying in an attic apartment which was the biggest deterrent for us over location. Also internet only available if you pay for it!! Absurd.....

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Roger186402
Reviews.Content: Not a lover of Novotels, I booked here reluctantly. However it turned out to be a pleasant surprise.Well situated for the CN tower and within walking distance of King street, ( nice for bars and restaurants). The pool was small and basic but they had one. The Esplanade is a good area for eating and a relaxing beer. Rooms are typical American style so it had everything you need. Try Bennigans for a steak on Queen street.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not if you need internet”
Reviews.Author: swfguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel for a few nights in March and it was a decent place for the money - a friend of mine described it as 'a good place if you're price conscious'. The hotel is fine, the room was fine, the restaurant and bar were fine. But I was in Toronto on business and the internet connection just sucked. For two days I was not able to log into my corporate network and that was not a good thing. So for the price it's great. But... if you need to get some work done this isn't the best option.

Reviews.Title: “Not in the Hospitality Business”
Reviews.Author: travellermimi
Reviews.Content: the place was near all main attractions but not recommended for people who expect value for money nor for those who expect hospitality....the workers work with the attitude of ' this is the service which are our wages worth' The front desk lady uttered two words and then asked her boss to come over for no apparent reason and the boss started to utter something about they cannot empty the minibar and they would put a fridge which the front desk lady could have said ....the Boss lady was using her hands and eyebrows to convey the talking in a way we watch in real housewives episodes .....very unprofessional and degrading. The room was clean and a fridge was placed as requested ( i asked to empty the minibar or to put a fridge at no extra cost............and to be honest i find it offensive to my religion to find alcoholics in the minibar so i asked for the first option which is empty the minibar).......the bathroom seemd recently renovated because it did not match the room style and the bathtub was extremely small especially for an 'executive room' which does not differ one bit from regular room except for the LCD TV. We had dinner in the restaurant with a pri-fix menu called theater menu which is only mentioned by named in their written menu and when u ask for the details the waiter slurred the details and has nervously reptead the options as if i had to memorize it to pick what i wanted we had to check out at 12 o'clock so literally at 10:45 the cleaning lady decided she wants to clean the room and entered without notice and my husband told her we have not checked out yet and she can come back later.....which she did 20 minutes again ...again without knocking but this time we had the door locked .......so not sure whats happening there the breakfast did not have any kind of salad ......nor gluten free options.....the bread served the first day was baked at least one week earlier cause u could hurt someone if u hit him/her using it......the second day there was a limited number of two seating tables and the one i choose was not clean and i was waiting for the waiter to clean and she said again using her eyebrows and finger 'she has many other things to do other than cleaning the table'.....and for some reason they expected to be tipped after this behaviour......the person who escorts u to your table was a little better than the rest though so very bad service not worth tipping.......and not hospitality trained ppl for sure

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great”
Reviews.Author: gerrykaka
Reviews.Content: Great service,nice room,great breakfast. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “a nice three star hotel which was and quiet and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: travelwhisperer53
Reviews.Content: i had gotten a deal off hotwire and that is the reason i booked at this hotel. Upon arrival we were informed we had a smoking room which was not what i had requested. The man at the front desk said that because of getting a deal fromn hotwire they were limited in the rooms they provided . Hhe said he was unable to change the room because there were no other's available which i really wonder was true but there was little i could do. The room was big and clean but the smell of smoke really was a real turn off . Thankfully we did not spend alot of time in the room. The roomneed a new updated flatscreen as the room seemed a little outdated. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom very spacious . I found the front desk very friendly and helful and allowed me to store my bag there after checking out . I sid not use the pool but found it clean and well kept up. I did not do the breakfast buffet which it 16.95 but found it had a a variety of different things that would satisfy quests, but near the hotel is Fran's which is a great breakfast place. Liked the fact there was a computer in the lobby to access which was a nice touch .The location was great and there was alot of nice places to eat . A added bonus it was close to union station . Overall i would go back if i was able to get a non smoking room the next time when booking on Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “A terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Cartsjr
Reviews.Content: I was charged a mini-bar fee of $60 for every item in the mini-bar - items I did not consume! I moved items out of the mini-bar to cool my own beverages. The hotels beverages were left on top of the mini-bar. When the extra charge appeared on my credit card, I requested their error be reversed but they refused. Also, the TVs are old fashioned and our of date. Also my room was not ready when I arrived, so I put my luggage in their storage. When I later retrieved my luggage, they put it on a trolley for me and I took it up to my room, only to realize when I was leaving the next day that I had an extra bag which was not mine. Imagine being the person whose bag was lost over night. I will never stay here again. What a terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay - near to the Union Station”
Reviews.Author: laetitiaGermany
Reviews.Content: We had great 3 nights at the Novotel Toronto Centre, a wonderful stay in this modern city. The hotel is well-equiped with internet wi-fi, coffee-maker in the room, great large and comfortable beds in a room with good space for two people. The breakfast was delicous and great in variety, worths the price. Around the hotel you can find the St. Lawrence Market in a few steps, with its great options of restaurants and groceries. There are also CafÃ©s in the neighborhood and a supermarket called "Metro". The best is the Union Station, just 2 blocks from the hotel, so we could catch our train to Ottawa in just a few minuts, as far as the access to the subway. The 17km complex of TorontoÂ´s shopping center is also accessed in front of the Union Square, and the huge CN tower is very near, too. We had a pleasant sojourn and recommend the stay. Toronto is a great place and we will come back, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Professional as always. Great.”
Reviews.Author: ianthomson83
