Reviews.Content: I have to say I had a very comfortable bed, it did make it extra hard to get up! The room was spacious, and more than enough for me to do my yoga stretches. I always feel very comfortable when travelling on business staying at Novotel. It met my expectations so I hope to stay with you again when I am back in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “We had an ant infestation in our room ..”
Reviews.Author: Stevekoroll
Reviews.Content: After complaining about our ant problem they simply moved us to a different , equally terrible room... The hotel staff didn't really seem to care at all.. Gross rooms and unfriendly staff..

Reviews.Title: “Four stars, really?”
Reviews.Author: jolotraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel for five days to attend a business meeting that was being held at the hotel. I would never stay here again. Upon arrival, which was well after the 3p check-in time, I was given a room that had not yet been serviced. I received no apology from the front-desk staff or even eye contact as she rebooked me into another room. Terrible customer service. I can attest that the hotel service staff have a tough time cleaning the rooms in a timely manner. On another day, when I was out of the room until after 2p, my room had not yet been serviced. The internet service was extremely slow and timed out constantly. This is terribly inconvenient for business travelers and the free computer in the lobby had an even worse connection - very slow, frequently timed out. There are two computers in the lobby for guests use, and on each day I was staying at the hotel, one of them was out of service. The rooms are clean and spacious, but not very well decorated. The bed was comfortable. But, the TV in the room is old. There was no space to store my clothes. The furniture that the TV was sitting on had a huge knick on the edge and the hotel staff colored it in with black marker. Classy. One huge bonus for the hotel is that it is close to everything. Its only a block from the Hockey Hall of Fame, numerous shops and restaurants. Several are right across from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Two-night stay with cold showers and poor manager response!”
Reviews.Author: JandJ123
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at the Novotel in April. The room itself was clean. However when we turned the water on to shower, we could only get a just-warm mix of cold water with a small bit of hot mixed in. Suffice to say, we complained the first night. They sent a worker to check it. He said they could try a few different things. The second evening, we attempted to shower with the same water results. We called the front desk to complain again that there was still not hot water in our shower. We asked the girl to note our account of this second complaint for when we checked out in the morning. She assured us she would. Well, when we checked out the next morning and made reference to the two days stay without hot water in our shower, and that our account should have been noted as such that we had called twice, the gentleman who was processing our checkout said there was no record of it in their computer. We gave him the name of the girl who we had spoken to and the time we had called. No reference he said. We asked what could they do for us in reference to our experience and he said, "Because you booked your stay online through a third party, there is nothing we can do. We don't even know how much you were charged for the rooms." And he proceeded to charge us the full amount for two nights plus the parking fees. We asked to speak with the manager. Him listening to our concerns said he would research this and call us the next day. He later called and said that the reason they couldnâ€™t get into our room the second evening to â€œfixâ€� our hot water was because we had a do not disturb card on our door. This didnâ€™t make sense to us as the previous evening they had simply called our room to let us know a gentleman was coming up to check the shower water. So the manager refunded our parking charges for our inconvenience. Two nights of cold showers and all we got for it was free parking. We were very disappointed and thought this was very poor business, especially for visiting Americans who love Toronto. Again, if you like cold showers, stay at the Novotel Toronto Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: kmn1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our 15 year old son spent the week of March break at the Novotel in Toronto. It was a very enjoyable stay. The hotel is very clean, has friendly and helpful staff and was very accommodating to our needs. We requested a small fridge for our room to keep snacks and beverages which was provided at no extra cost. We also needed an extra late check-out which also was no problem. The room was spacious and clean as was the bathroom. The hotel offers a buffet breakfast which we enjoyed a few times. There was a wide variety of items available. Quite good. The location of the hotel is perfect. Short walk to the subway, St. Lawrence Market which is fabulous and walking distance to a lot of other sites and excellent restaurants. Would stay there again without a doubt. Indoor parking is available for $20/day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value the Money”
Reviews.Author: theromos
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel this past weekend. We travelled to Toronto to see the CN Tower - which was a huge let down. This hotel was right downtown on the Esplanade - right across from The Old Spaghetti Factory. Very nice hotel, parking was easily accessible and reasonably priced. The high speed internet is included in the room. Many hotels downtown you have to pay an additional charge for internet usage. The staff were friendly upon arrival. The security is great - you have to insert your hotel room card in the elevator before you can go up in the elevator, and I really appreciated this extra level of security. Hotel was very clean, beds were great and comfy. Pool was fine and we all enjoyed our stay. Kids under 15 get breakfast for free in the morning, so that was also an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, expensive,terrible WiFi in room.”
Reviews.Author: leceltique
Reviews.Content: Was there for 4 nights. Very expensive for ordinary room. Friendly staff. However, phone did not work in room. Took 2 days for them to fix it. They do not put sheet on bed. Only bedspread and fitted sheet. They said it was a European thing. Bedsheet was in closet. So basically you have to make your own bed. Free WiFi in rooms is horrible. Clean rooms and nice location near Pubs (Irish Embassy) and market. Too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION/POOR SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: 6349571Sue
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great Location. Rooms are small and plain. Toilet overflowed the morning of our checkout. Manager was not there to deal with it. Staff needs to be trained on better customer service. Will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our place to stay in Toronto...”
Reviews.Author: RedMollie1974
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here 4 or 5 times now, usually a weekend when we have a concert to go to or other events planned in the city. We first chose the Novotel because we love using the large hot tub and pool, especially in the winter! Dinner across the street at The Bier Markt is also a favourite, especially on the patio in Summer. We also love that we can take the bus from our home in Aurora and have a short walk; under 10 minutes; from the bus station to the Novotel. Staff are always friendly and accommodating, rooms and shared spaces (pool, hot tub etc.) are clean and comfortable and we always enjoy our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: KariHearn
Reviews.Content: The Novotel was charming and was in a great location for our first stay in Toronto. Our room however was a little disapointing. The air con/heating took some getting used to, a bit noisy, but nothing that really bothered us. Our view was of a multi-storey carpark which made our room very dark. But we made do with the room we booked. The dining room was excellent. We dined there every night we stayed and was made very welcome by a member of staff who kept on checking on how things were. He always made time for me and my boyfriend and asked us about our trip etc. I will miss this! Would I come and stay here again? Oh yes! This hotel was far better than I any I have stayed in before!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: naivete
Reviews.Content: We got a special deal for this hotel room (95$/night if I remember correctly), which was great value for a hotel in downtown Toronto. We liked that it was pretty close to the train station, enough so that we didn't need to hail a cab. We almost walked everywhere, even though Toronto is quite cold in January! The room itself was like any other mid-range quality hotel, standard accommodation, but with a very comfortable bed, a coffee machine (hate when hotels don't have those!), etc. Everything was very clean, which is basically the most important criteria for me. The only downside I could see was that the walls are not very soundproof... Some people woke us up one night because they were yelling in the hallways. Oh, and must Novotel use plastic cups when they also put glass cups right beside them? They tell us not to wash our towels everyday to save the environment, but what about all this waste in the landfills? My two cents. Otherwise everything was fine! I would go back at such a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Lukewarm”
Reviews.Author: deltronzer0
Reviews.Content: The rooms are adequate, but not amazing. I lost my room card within 2 hours of arriving and it was replaced no questions asked. I haven't checked out yet so I'm curious to see how much that will cost me. The hot water last night barely got above room temperature, which is not ideal when you are trying to defrost from the Toronto weather. The fridge can't be used for putting your own food in, it is purely there as a mini bar. That being said, I did store food in mine, but if you want to do that, make sure to hang the do not disturb sign, or the cleaner will throw away your food. The wifi is good, I'm using it now. The tv has a Internet function, but you have to pay to use it. The location I'd good - right near st Lawrence market. There is also a huge supermarket nearby is you want to eat cheaply, it had lots of pre-prepared meals like sandwiches and sushi and is open 24 hours. The airport express doesn't stop here, but the closest stop is not far - near the royal york, less than 1pm away.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Pool and fitness center was under renovation, so we couln't enjoy the pool, especially when outside was snowing and the temparature was -10 C.

Reviews.Title: “For business not for pleasure”
Reviews.Author: RachCaz
Reviews.Content: I suppose this is what you get when you stay at a big impersonal chain. We didn't get a smile or any real assistance from the staff no offer of help as we struggled through the door with our bags they just leered at us from behind the desk and when we asked for a map it got handed to us and when I asked to be shown where the hotel was on the map I just got 'it's marked on there' we did finally locate a small penned on mark eventually. We got gouged on making calls and the buffet breakfast was ordinary and overpriced. The cold reception really tainted our whole perception of Toronto don't think we'll be going back and will never stay at a novotel hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Mini-vacation in the city”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for a little break after Christmas. Booked a couple of months in advance when there was a terrific promotion on room rate so excellent value. Enjoyed the pool facilities and hotel proximity to downtown sites such as Hockey Hall of Fame and Air Canada Centre. Breakfast buffet was economical and satisfying particularly for the kids (who ate for free). The room and other areas of the hotel were clean. The general vibe is it is a self-service hotel. Limited staff at the front desk and in the bar/restaurant. You don't see other staff in the hotel except for house cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & Pedestrian Friendly”
Reviews.Author: soccergrrl5
Reviews.Content: Even though it's been 1/2 a year since I was there, I still remember my stay w/ my buddy @ the NTC--b/c, it was memorable enough to note. Hotel & Room Specs: Easy check-in, staff was friendly (though not outstanding--since, I don't remember any employee's name). There are 2 huge Macs in the lobby for Free, timed WiFi INET service--although, it was slow @ times. There is a little "souvenir shop"--but, there are more near the hotel--no worries! :D The facility is beautiful, even for its compact lobby. It was very easy to navigate the hotel. Especially since we were content w/ being IN the city & out and about :). The rooms were spacious & complete w/ modernized furniture that still contained comfortable beds that you could most definitely sink into. I'm a total fan o' the huge recyclable bins & the toiletries were nice additions as well (b/c, you know... the generic, strange scented toiletries are never fun). Location & ease o' finding the Hotel: First, for someone from the States, finding the Esplanade was not a challenge, despite its location to (literally) be down this diagonal side street. Rock a GPS unit & a great co-pilot--and, you're there! We had my truck & it was parked safely in the garage from the moment we pulled in, till when we left. It is pay parking, but well worth it, to not worry about it. Neighborhood Specs: This location is near a lot o' fun for all different ages! We are "anything goes" travelers, so it was a great place for us! We enjoyed Bier Markt (yaya, for Bartender, Kevin :)) & Fionn MacCool's across the way. There were other pub/restaurants, but we mainly kept to those. Around the corner was: C'est What? and several other bars & restaurants. There are a lot o' touristy things w/in walking distance. Since we like coffee, it was cool to have a nice chain (Second Cup) a couple doors down from C'est What?. I'm sure there are more amazing, non-chain coffee places around there... but, this weekend was for celebration, a music fest & the most "touristy" stuff we could peruse, so SC was good for us. Also, the St. Lawrence Market was right down the street. You could lose yourself & time w/ all o' the "Farmer's Market-esque" feel indoors this place. Very cool. Check it out. Public Transportation: This is a reason I love coming back to this city. There are SO many options! This hotel is near the Street Cars (a crazy ride, let me tell you!) & their version o' the subway/metro. Also, the bus station was near as well. Taxis are everywhere & boy, are they friendly! (Seriously, I was handed a card from a driver to "remember to call him" for the next ride) Random: There is a Post Office down the Esplanade. Just in case you were wondering :)... Also, buy smokes in the States. The Canadian ones make you feel awful b/c they have these crazy warning labels on the pkgs and they're expensive! Closing Thoughts: Toronto is always tops on my list o' "favorite" places to visit. It is a great city w/ great people & I haven't even shared the other parts o' the adventure--b/c, what fun would that be? Create your own adventure! :D Visit this amazing place... and I know that I will definitely come back again (planning to in March 2011). I would stay @ the Novatel again... even if my next visit, I'll be somewhere different (b/c I'm going to be in another district o' Toronto this time).

Reviews.Title: “Sweet dreams”
Reviews.Author: travelandmedia Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Clean Hotel with superb service. Great bed and had an excellent night.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: Jugglerstein
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not that bad (it has a gym and is properly located for quick tourism), but every day I awoke with new bites in my arms and neck. This is the first time that I find something so nasty, and I have been in several countries -this year I have visited several countries at Europe, South and North America- without having such an unpleasant experience. Some of the staff guys are nice, but most of them can be very mean with non-native English speakers. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “clean but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: cns1201
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean in lobby areas and in the rooms. Although the rooms are very small and have no view of anything except a parking garage. The use of key cards in the elevator is a nice security feature but takes some getting use to. There are no microwaves in the room and if you want a fridge you must request for one in your room. There was no dresser in the room for your clothes and had to live from a suitcase for 5 days. The bathrooms are a nice size and very clean. We only ate in the restaurant once and had toast which they burnt and still served. At $4.00 for toast you would think they would not send out burnt toast. The location of this hotel is very close to public transit and is located on a fairly quiet street. The St. Lawrence market was only 2 blocks away and there were all kinds of restaurants in all price ranges within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “An okay Toronto hotel -- nothing special”
Reviews.Author: AdvisorKing
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel Toronto Centre for business during three days in October. I paid the conference rate of $120, which worked out to $141 per night, including taxes. When in Toronto, I typically stay at the Sheraton Centre because it is a little closer to where I need to be. The Novotel is a little farther from the business area around Eaton Centre that I typically visit. The Novotel is also a full step below the Sheraton in terms of the hotel rating, class and amentities. The rooms were plain and basic, although sufficiently spacious. I did note a bit of an antiseptic smell in the hallway (but not in the room) when I checked in. I assume this reflected that the area was clean, but it would have been more pleasant without the smell of chemical cleaners. My room had a view of the parking garage, which is certainly less enjoyable than the view I would get on, say, the 20th floor of the Sheraton. I used room service a couple times and they were very quick and the food was excellent. The internet access was included, which is easy to forget. Being charged for internet access is a pet peeve of mine. However, the mini-bar fridge had a sign on it saying that it was not a refrigerator and that any items placed in it would be removed. That seemed a little harsh and is far from normal in my reasonably significant hotelling experience. The next time Iâ€™m back in Toronto on business, Iâ€™ll probably try the Sheraton first (and a few other places second). But I wouldnâ€™t have a problem staying at the Novotel. In addition, if I was paying my own fare, Iâ€™d consider the Novotel at $120 over the Sheraton at, say, $200 per night.

Reviews.Title: “novotel toronto”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: was Great as usual, European service in the centre of the city

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, good clean hotel and great gym and sauna.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good breakfast buffet, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: pegan7700
Reviews.Content: Booked 6 months in advance directly with hotel on its web site for 3 nights. First stay in Toronto, and was a floor above barking dog, which was resolved thru front desk. Room was comfortable but opposite the hotel car park. The hotel dinner food was pedestrian and found better value across street at Spaghetti Factory and Fionn McCool's. Biggest disappointment was being pick pocketed in either hotel elevator or restaurant, but happily my empty wallet was turned in at front desk.

Reviews.Title: “an enjoyable stay - a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Tlivo
Reviews.Content: my husband and i are from the UK and spent the first 3 nights of honeymoon at this hotel. Although we did not have a particularly luxurious room it was clean and comfortable and good value. The central location was perfect for us and we found the hotel staff to be very helpful, they pointed us in the direction of trips and place to visit. The best thing about the hotel was the buffet breakfast which my husband was very pleased with and got our stay off to a great start! I do think the noise of the doors opening and closing may upset some people but that aside this was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant all round. A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: RobRobJenJen
Reviews.Content: 6 nights in peak season at Â£97/night, booked only 8 weeks ahead. The buffet breakfast wasnâ€™t inclusive for us, but was well worth the extra cost of CAD17pp for range, quality, ambience and service. This was accommodation of a very high standard and only 5-10 mins walk to central downtown. Restaurants across the road. Bags of space in both bedroom and bathroom. Lovely dining and reception areas. Excellent pool with views (see photo). One minor criticism â€“ sometimes there was a bit of a wait at reception (hence the marking down to 4 for Service). (One of 8 accommodations reviewed this holiday) One strong recommendation for flights: If route exists, take Porter Airlines from Billy Bishop (Island) Airport. We flew to Boston MA â€“ very civilised, quicker and cheaper to airport, much shorter check-in time than Pearson, much the same flight cost (after adding hefty airport fees).

Reviews.Title: “Go for the location, stay for the breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: sabadeeb
Reviews.Content: Took a fall getaway with my husband to see Niagara Falls and Toronto. The location of this Novotel was perfect for all the sightseeing we wanted to do. It is in close proximity to Union Station, the CN Tower, St. Lawrence Market and the distillery district as well as a healthy walk to Chinatown and Kensington. The desk service was rather indifferent. When I asked if there was a concierge, I was told that there wasn't, unfortunately. Nothing more! No offer to answer a question or give a direction. The head went down, and that was it, even though there was no line at the desk. Other than that, the Novotel experience was quite positive. The room was very clean and quite ample for the two of us, despite the view of the parking garage. The bathroom amenities were a bit skimpy; no body lotion or conditioner, but very nice shower gel, soap and shampoo. The pool seemed fine. The hot tub was wonderful! Pool and hot tub area were connected by a stairway to the fairly decent gym, which had good showers with shampoo, shower gel and conditioner in dispensers and a sauna. The breakfast buffet was wonderful! Eggs benedict, french toast, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage and the most delicious selection of fresh baked breads and pastries one could want! Be sure to get the breakfast buffet included, especially if you are going to walk around the city for any length of time. Plus, the hosts and servers at the restaurant are excellent! They are far more friendly than the desk staff, with smiles and cheerful greetings! The waitstaff are quite attending and deserve their tips! I was looking around after I sat down with my food, wondering if I should get up to get some juice, when a waiter asked if I needed anything. It was at the same time I noticed where the juice was. I said I was going to get some juice, and he insisted on getting it for me! That's the kind of service I like! If you could get along without a concierge, and with meager bath amenities, this hotel would be perfect for your trip to Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “toronto visit”
Reviews.Author: oldie64Kent
Reviews.Content: The Novotel hotel, the esplenade Toronto, a great hotel, the rooms were very clean and the staff were always very helpful. The hotel is very easy walking distance from the CN tower. The breakfasts at the hotel are very good too. We found the hotel a very good base to discover Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously the worst hotel I've stayed in.....”
Reviews.Author: DebAustralia
Reviews.Content: My husband & I planned our Canada trip well in advance - I booked the Novotel Toronto Centre in late 2009, I received a confirmation of booking email and a further email saying "we look forward to seeing you on...". We arrive at the Hotel in September 2010 only to be told there was no room for us, I produced my confirmation and after much waiting at the front desk the rather abrupt receptionist told us to wait in the lounge and she would speak to her manager. After nearly an hours wait the manager came to us asking for further information about our booking - all of which I had already given to the receptionist - a further wait of an hour and finally they magically found a room for us. NO apology for the wait and no explanation as to what happened. The room smelt like cigarettes, it was opposite the ice machine in the hallway which everyone used until late at night, it was an interconnecting room and the people next door had a daughter who sang at the top of her voice on arriving home every evening. It was also opposite the lifts with people coming and going until all hours. We found some horrible mouldy thing in the fridge that had been left by a previous guest and there was hair all over the bathroom floor and walls. Breakfast was supposed to be included but on our last morning we had to leave early for a bus connection to the airport and therefore we could not have breakfast as our sitting didn't start until half an hour after we were to leave. Even though breakfast had already started to be served - we could not even get a cup of coffee without being charged for it. On this trip we stayed in around 12 different hotels in Canada - all of which we had great service, wonderfully clean and spacious rooms and a terrific experience - on my experience at the Novotel in Toronto - I WILL NEVER STAY IN A NOVOTEL ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD AGAIN. Avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad mini-bar”
Reviews.Author: stylish_30
Reviews.Content: Standard Novotel quality - decent size of room , comfortable bed, great location close to all major sights and Union Station. Rooms are well maintained as you would expect from Novotel. Negatives - they have the annoying mini bar system that has sensors that automatically charge you if an item is removed, so you cannot use it to chill your own wine. There are ice machines and decent sized buckets provided , however. The check-in clerk was a bit abrupt but that might be the Canadian way; she was not impolite.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoniaA2
Reviews.Content: staff really helpfull and location is amazing really central, and near all main atractions

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel near St. Lawrence Market and train station”
Reviews.Author: SaraEOakland
Reviews.Content: We just spent four nights here and really made good use of the excellent location. We could walk to St. Lawrence Market for breakfast every morning (great pastries and coffee), a milliner, a knitter/artist, food suppliers and little shops. We were also within luggage-rolling distance of Union Station. We walked one night to MarchÃ©, a kind of upscale food court with lots of good choices, and one night to Mercatto (reservations required) - good Italian, recommended by friends, good service and excellent thin-crust pizza. Our room was spacious (two queen) and by booking well in advance we paid only $120 on weeknights and $130 on Th-Fr. Rates go up further on event weekends (such as TIFF). There are two computers in the lobby for guest use (although painfully slow and they ration you at 20 minutes), but we almost always got on when we needed to. The time limit gave everyone a chance. We stayed here about four years ago and would do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Free internet a big bonus”
Reviews.Author: jess_bessAustralia
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel, close to amenities and good staff. It has two computers with free internet in the foyer for guests to use which I appreciated. I am sick of paying exorbitant internet fees at hotels. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad location, otherwise pretty average”
Reviews.Author: 5kmilesin2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located downtown (very good) but across the street from some restaurants/bars with outdoor patios. If your room faces that direction, and you are a light sleeper, you may be kept awake. Clean room, but a little worn out - you could feel the springs when you sat on the day bed. Noisy guests - most guests seemed on the younger side (25-35 yrs) - and my colleague had to call down to the desk one night to get her neighbors to quiet down. Maybe it was the film fest crowd? Front desk staff did not create a good first impression. The woman started checking me in before she was finished with the guest in front of me. Basically threw a pen and sheet of paper at us, gave us our room keys, and took off. Clearly had better things to do than welcome paying guests to her hotel. Subsequent dealings with front desk were ok but not exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Buffet”
Reviews.Author: Snout117
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is fantastic. Right across from restaurants and close to all the downtown sights. The buffet breakfast was included in our rate and it was great! The rooms and the service were good. We were a little disappointed that we didn't get the upgraded room we booked and were charged for, but once I pointed it out to the front desk staff they took care of it right away and credited our account, so no big deal. Overall we had a great experience and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Numberoneguest
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. Location is great both for main city centre and harbour area. Friendly welcome and nice large room with two double beds. Breakfast was good. I echo the comment of an earlier contributor regarding the presentation of a bill after each breakfast even though the rate included breakfast. Rooms are large and well appointed although our bathroom plumbing had a few problems with the toilet often continuing to fill for long periods and the basin not emptying quickly - not worth reporting on such a short stay. Two Apple computers worked well in reception and there was never really a queue unlike in other Novotels I have stayed in. Reception booked an excellent taxi/limo to airport for fixed rate of $55 - definitely recommend that option. For family eating I would recommend the new Marche restaurant on Yonge Street about 5 minutes walk from hotel - great choice of food and good value. Hire a car for Niagara rather than take the train (expensive for a family and station not near falls). We used Hertz who have cars about 5 minutes walk from hotel in modern underground car park (office in Union Station).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, ideally located a few...”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Lion_10
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, ideally located a few minutes' walk from Union Station and St Lawrence Market. Rooms are large and spacious with coffee maker and good soundproofing. Staff were very friendly and breakfast very good indeed

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in toronto”
Reviews.Author: nbow
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, good value, good location! The rooms were clean, the hotel was nice and modern and the staff was polite! It's maybe a 5-6min walk from the train station and so you don't have to cab very far. We went to see a football game and walked back from the Rogers Centre so it wasn't a bad walk either we had a breakfast buffet included in our package and it was really good food with lots to choose from, I have stayed there a couple of times now and happy each time!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing breakfast but otherwise great”
Reviews.Author: kathyoliver
Reviews.Content: The room was lovely - two large double beds and lots of room for a travel cot as well. We enjoyed the swimming pool, and the location was great. We were really disappointed by the breakfast though. The buffet was really quite expensive (although children ate free) and poor quality for the price. No waffles or pancakes, the pastries were dry, and the french toast was greasy and lukewarm. We wished we'd found the Tim Hortons up the road earlier in our stay. Also, parking is very expensive at $20 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: YenterBetty
Reviews.Content: That hotel is really nice and their breakfast meal is really CHAMP! It was easy to walk around into downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Attitude seemed to be 'It's a privilege for you to stay in our hotel'”
Reviews.Author: Adam081
Reviews.Content: Got a good rate at this hotel, with breakfast included, and stayed a couple of nights. Hotel is acceptable, but it is the type of place where you really only want to sleep. Didn't find reception staff very friendly at all - got the impression that they would prefer you not to approach them! These poor people skills seemed to filter down from above, following one encounter at the reception. Room was very old, in need of refurbishment. My room was at the back of the hotel which had an awful view of a parking lot. The window doesn't open, which is annoying. Disappointing room, especially since the entrance to the hotel and lobby suggests a better standard hotel which does have great potential. Even the standard Novotel picture in the room seemed to be hung the wrong way round! Hotel is quite large, so it can be a bit noisy. Elevators to the rooms required use of the room key at all times, which after a while became a chore - although I do understand the security element. Cleaning service was always in the late afternoon (5 / 6pm), except on the day I was leaving! Breakfast was buffet style, and was generally good, although it did become fairly repetitive after a few mornings. Service was ok, but I did find it strange to be presented with a bill each morning when breakfast was included in my room rate - the bill just had a blank for a tip. Restaurant staff were generally great, although some staff who had served me on previous mornings chose not to salute me on other mornings - so much for their tip! Restaurant always seemed to be empty in the evenings, as was the lounge! But the area has great restaurants and bars opposite. Reception area has two computers with internet access - usefully, there is a 20 minute timeout on these, but there still seemed to be a line, often waiting for children to finish. Probably the best aspect of the hotel is its location, very close to Union Station and a lot of restaurants in front of the hotel. Otherwise, rooms and staff attitude could be improved a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Book now”
Reviews.Content: Great location and best value for money hotel.We usualy stay at the Delta Chelsea but it was full. Chose this hotel for it's location as it's easy walking distance to a lot of the sights in Toronto. We were very happy with all aspects of our stay and if you are looking for a good 3-4 star place to stay in, then this is up with the best.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: MariMichelena
Reviews.Content: great breakfast, good novotel service and the rooms that look just the same anywhere in the world but are modern, clean, and comfortable. maybe lacks personality. very good price for the excelent central location.

Reviews.Title: “Very good facilities, location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: thegrumpys
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Toronto. We had a fabulous time and our stay at the Novotel enhanced this. Facilites were excellent. Great location, large well appointed rooms, right next door to the swimming pool (result! when you want to unwind after a day out) and the most friendly and helpful staff who gave excellent advice on the best places to visit during our stay as well as organising a trip to Niagara for us. A special mention to the barman who was charm personified and gave us great advice on how to get around and what to see. We only hope that the Maple Leafs give him something to cheer about next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value and stay”
Reviews.Author: FaithJ
Reviews.Content: We found the location perfect as we were attending a conference at the Air Canada Centre and touring about downtown area in between meeting times. Everything was in walking distance. Novotel located on a quiet, pretty street. We checked out the nearby market and grabbed some breakfast foods and snacks. This was a great tip from another review, as the snacks in the room are high priced. The staff were very helpful and kept our bags for us both on our early arrival and late check out, so we could go touring about. There are several lovely outdoor restaurants just down the street and the St. Lawerence Market is a must to check out. The rooms were exactly as represented on the website and we had a nice view of the main street. For the price and location, this place was perfect for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - budget bedding”
Reviews.Author: lifterguy
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the Novotel, I was greeted promptly and professionally at the front desk and quickly checked-in. The desk clerk offered me a map and provided instructions for getting into their clean and well-lit parking garage. (Parking is $20 per day extra.) The hotel public areas were clean and inviting. The elevators were fairly fast. They required a room key-card to access the upper floors - a little annoying, but a nice safety feature. The fifth floor room had basic furnishings that were in good condition: Two queen size beds with night stands attached to the wall, a desk, dresser, and a couple of comfortable chairs by the window. The TV was a standard tube set, with basic cable. The bathroom was clean with plenty of counter space and nice lighting. A hair dryer, iron and ironing board were all provided. There was no fridge, except for a mini-bar with the usual overpriced items. The hotel offers free wireless internet, and the signal appeared to be strong, but the speed was very slow - freezing at times. Don't depend on using the wireless internet if you really intend to get any work done. The bed was uncomfortably firm. Each bed had three smallish feather pillows, and three smaller decorative throw pillows. When we went to get into bed, we found it had been made with just one white flat sheet (that barely covered the mattress) and the comforter with no blanket or top sheet. I doubt the comforter gets washed between guest, so I can't imagine guests using the bed this way. (And the comforter would have been way too warm for an August night - even with the air conditioning.) I found a blanket and two spare sheets in the closet, so I re-made the bed with a top sheet and a blanket. The sheets and blanket all looked like the kind you would find in a cheap budget motel. Noise from the hallway would intrude into the room when people talking would pass by outside - fortunately the hallway was quite during most of our visit. Lighting in the room was just barely adequate. Bedside lights built into the headboards looked sleek, but were not all that good for reading. The hotel has a workout room that has a couple of treadmills, 2 elliptical trainers, 2 exercise bikes, and a stair stepper machine. There is also a small selection of weight machines, and even some free weights. It's not a substitute for a full size gym, but it's enough for a basic workout. There is also an indoor pool, which we did not use. Overall it's a nice hotel, and the location close to Yonge Street and St. Lawrence Market is terrific. The price we paid was competitive with other downtown Toronto hotels - but I still ended up feeling like we spent too much for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: piper181
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a place with a great location, nice people, and comfy rooms all at a reasonable price. You are a "stone's throw" from the train station and a myriad of restaurants and bars. The pool is, like others have said, best forgotten but that is a small price to pay for such a wonderful place in all other respects. When in Toronto I would recommend this hotel and should I ever return, I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jefito
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Novotel Toronto Center for two nights! The hotel is located very close to the main sights of the downtown!Right around the corner is the Hokey Hall of Fame and down the street is the CN Tower, Air Canada Center, Roger Center and the famous commercial Yonge Street. Only a few minutes is the harbour front area! The staff were very polite and profesional!The room was spacious, clean and comfortable! We didn't try the breakfast as it was not included in the booking price! Please pay attention just in case that you want to use the minibar,it has some short of weight-sensing technology in it ,which activated when anything is lifted....and the get billed for it!The best thing to do is not to store anything in it! Free wireless internet was great but only for a limited time if I remember well it was only for 20min by using a personal password. From my point of view the biggest drawback was that we had to pay for a parking during our stay! I would definately recommend this hotel and stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but forget the pool”
Reviews.Author: TopCats
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights as part of my 50th Birthday treat in May this year. Found the hotel to be clean and tidy and in a fantastic location, easy walking distance from all major attractions in the city. We had a free upgrade to an executive room on the top floor, but apart from beaing larger with a fancy bathroom, it was pretty standard Novotel fare. Breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice, and the best museli I've ever tasted! We didn't use the hotel for evening meals but ate out instead. Can reccomend the Spaghetti Factory opposite if you want a good value, no frills italian meal. Great for kids too, in fact many families where there when we visited. Reception was freindly and helpful too. The only down side was the pool. It was on the 6th floor I think, but a floor above the changing rooms and Gym. Pool was cold and un attended. Also my wife had a problem with the changing room which had no working lights - there where two maintenance men in the gym area at the time, but they didn't seem to want to help with the light. On teh whole, we had a great stay, despite the pool incident.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly and helpful staff, large clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Reichau
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four days recently at the Novotel. We were impressed with the helpful, friendly and efficient staff. The buffet breakfast was very good. Location is very central and good restaurants can be found nearby. We found the room large and clean, with excellent mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “go for it”
Reviews.Author: JSX
Reviews.Content: great location, with some awesome outdoor dning options nearby. Pool was great indoors, good temp, not overly chlorine-y and good hot spa. Breakfast service was hit and miss but quite amusing and entertaining if you take it for what it was- a buffet after all. Being an Aussie we are used to "variable" service standards - but you get what you pay for and this was fine and good value for the price. Would certainly stay again for the location and room comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Full breakfast was...”
Reviews.Author: travelforanswers
Reviews.Content: Good location. Full breakfast was included. Not as expensive as other hotels. Location excellent: st lawrence market one block away, union station 3 blocks. The Old Spaghetti Factory is a beautiful restaurant in front of the hotel. Meal was good but not great, however you got to see the inside of the restaurant! Free internet in the lobby; rooms were large and clean. Service was good. I will stay here again. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, ideal position”
Reviews.Author: RetiredDarlington
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Novotel Toronto Centre for 3 nights in June. Our room was large, clean, and well maintained. We had two queen beds, which were large and very comfortable. Although our room was across the street from the Old Spaghetti House, and three pubs the glazing and curtains were so good that we never heard a sound from any of them. The staff were always pleasant and helpful. We will have no hesitation about staying there again. We hired a car (from Thrifty at the railway station five minutes away from the hotel) to go to Niagara. It was much cheaper than a bus tour, and suited us perfectly - we could go when and where we wanted rather than operating to a timetable. Toronto itself, although very attractive, desperately needs a good, quick, inexpensive system of public transport between the airport and downtown!

Reviews.Title: “An Incredible Gem”
Reviews.Author: worldlyCanada
Reviews.Content: The downtown Novotel is located in a beautiful heritage building that was once the Olde Yorke Esplanade Hotel. Having just finished staying at the Westin 5 star chain, I can honestly say that when all is said and done, the Novotel is far more intuitive in terms of meeting the customerâ€™s needs. They get it. From affordable room service, to inclusive buffet breakfast, to all the amenities in the room, including fee wireless internet, I have been so impressed with this hotel. When I stayed at the Westin, it was full of affectations: all icing but little cake. Novotel, on the other hand had it all and more. It has the aestherics, comfort, and service that made my 5 days in TO most enjoyable. This is a gem; close to the downtown core but without the downtown cost.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly okay”
Reviews.Author: carlininwindsor
Reviews.Content: The location is phenomenal. The staff were polite. The room was clean. The halls weren't particularly attractive, but well-lit. The breakfast was wonderful. My big complaint is that the A/C in the room didn't work. I complained after the first night, but nothing was done. Our room was quite hot and it made sleep quite difficult. Also, when I checked in, I asked that there be no feather or down pillows in the room. I was assured there were not. Nearly every pillow in the room had feathers or down. I know this is considered a luxury by some , but I'm allergic to down. I would probably stay there again, but I'd be more demanding about the A/C and the pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Jubsy007
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here at the beginning of April and it really was the perfect choice for a short stay in Toronto. The hotel is close to everything and we walked almost everywhere. Hotel staff could not have been more helpful and the rooms were nice and big. The only letdown for me was that our room seemed to be located next to the air conditioning units so there was a constant humming sound, but eventually we got used to it. The breakfast buffet was absolutely fantastic with a huge selection of anything you could want and the breakfast staff was brilliant. If you can get a deal with breakfast included it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Uggh”
Reviews.Author: Nerve_Doc
Reviews.Content: Hotel was not well situated for the convention center. The hotel placed a $200 hold on my credit card for incidentals and left it in place for 5 days. They refused to print an itemized bill which made getting my reimbursement a nightmare. I was told that the manager was busy changing his clothes and could not take my phone call, I was placed on hold for a long time trying to resolve this. Hotel lobby has a dank odor. Fitness room was well equipped, pool was small but clean. Stylish paint colors. The desk lamp in my room was not plugged in and the credenza was too heavy to move so I had little light for working or reading.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: jess_lau
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults and two children of 10 and 9) very much enjoyed this hotel! We were in Toronto for a wedding that weekend, and we were so lucky to find such a great place! We had asked for one standard room with 2 double beds. However, they had made a mistake and put us into 2 rooms with each one double bed. When we explained the situation to the staff at the reception, they were very understanding and helpful. There were absolutely no more rooms having 2 double beds (in standard rooms or other), so they moved us up to first class. We still had to be in separate rooms, but it ended up fine. We appreciated the kindness of the staff. Rooms were very nice, we slept great and the beds were really comfy! The hotel was very clean, which was also appreciated. The food was great- the buffet at morning had everything imaginable: croissants, pancakes, cereals, toasts, pastries, fruits (etc.). For lunch, we were so full that we decided to skip the meal after such a big breakfast! And for dinner, we instead enjoyed food in town. Around the hotel are many choices of restaurants that we all enjoyed. We ate Chinese, Greek, French Gastronomic... The proximity of all these places was great! There was a park right near by, all downtown Toronto museums, tall buildings and tourist attractions... The location was great for us! We overall really enjoyed the Novotel Toronto Centre and would definitely not hesitate to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Abol4
Reviews.Content: After a long flight from the UK it was great to check into such a nice hotel - we'd pre-booked and pre-paid and check in took only a moment. Located only minutes from the main train station, an airport bus drop-off point, the main shopping streets, harbour front etc - and yet it is situated in what felt like quite a quiet side street (which also had a small selection of bars and restaurants). We thought the room was great - family rooms in the UK usually have pull out beds or sofa-beds for kids so the extra space and big comfy beds were a bonus. Breakfast was the best thing - expensive per person, but because kids eat free it worked out a real bargain because there was so much choice and all four of us could eat loads for the same price probably as a coffee & donut elsewhere. We couldn't fault this hotel - we'd love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: HoHumAnotherTrip
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in extremely convenient location - handy for downtown, harbour area and St Lawrence Market. Room was very large and clean and quiet, staff were helpful and friendly and the beds were very comfortable. Heating/aircon worked effectively too. We preferred it to the Royal York to be honest - rooms are larger, and just as comfortable. And a lot cheaper. We didn't eat there (breakfast was cornflakes and milk from the minimart 20 metres away instead). Reception warned us that the minibar has some sort of weight-sensing technology in it which works out when anything is lifted - and you then get billed for it. So probably best not to store anything in it! Free wireless internet was great, and the coffee is free (though the bottled water would have been extortionate if we'd drunk it). Only slight downside - the bedroom carpet was a little grubby.

Reviews.Title: “hard to top this stay”
Reviews.Author: luvtogogirl22
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews that weren't very positive I've concluded that some people don't get out very often. We arrived in Toronto 3 hours before posted check-in time, and not only were we given our room and parking, but we were upgraded immediately to a beautiful room with a great view. We were greeted at the front desk with big smiles and professional courtesy. We travel to Ottawa a lot, and stay in a few different places in roughly the same price range and none of them were as comfortable and eye-pleasing as this! Very central to everything, and taking advantage of the breakfast buffet was definately worth it! Thanks Karan and others!

Reviews.Title: “A great affordable place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: SarniaWeekender
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Novotel The Esplanade for the Eric Clapton/Jeff Beck concert. I found the hotel very comfortable & clean. The staff were very accommodating & friendly. This hotel is close the everything downtown , restaraunts , bars , shopping , etc. The price included breakfast which was very good , a nice selection to choose from. The only 2 things that I guess might be an issue were my view , a condo & parking garage & my coffee maker didn't work the 2nd night. I requested another one at 2:30 am & even though the hotel was entirly booked , they found me a second coffee maker at such an early hour. It didn't work either. The fact they even located one for me at that late hour was very honourable & very thoughtful. I would call that guest service at its best. I would definately stay here again , but , request a better view next time & check out the coffee maker a little earlier. All in all , I had a very pleasant experience here!

Reviews.Title: “Great especially for the price!”
Reviews.Author: ashey88
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Novotel in July 2008 and it was wonderful! The location is amazing and the rooms are beautiful and modern. You also can't beat the price, I think we paid about $100 for the night which was amazing considering you're right down town.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but noisy”
Reviews.Author: blanketygoodness
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend because we were attending a party in the city. We wanted somewhere basic and cheap to spend the night, and this hotel pretty much fulfilled that purpose. The room was clean and comfortable and we were happy with it. We had a few drinks in the bar, which was nice, but didn't avail of any of the amenities so I can't comment on them. My only negative point is that the hotel is very loud. There were a lot of screaming children around when we were there, and we could hear everything going on in the corridors when we were in the room. After a night of partying we were woken up way too early by people talking loudly outside. Probably a good place for families, but not for single adults, couples or those on business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: MontyVancouver
Reviews.Content: Had to stay here for 5 nights for work. The room felt like a cave, small window and peeling wallpaper. Industrial carpets in the room were stained. Felt grimey and dirty. I had bought milk for my coffee in the am (trying not to use coffee mate) and during the day one of the "cleaners" had taken it out of the mini bar and left in on the counter. That put me over the edge. I saw the managers talking down very rudely to staff while they working out (staff wasn't folding the towels properly). If I didn't have to stay there with my work place (working to change this requirement) I would never ever pay on my own to stay there. Breakfast may be a bonus, but didn't get it offered to me.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: 406keem
Reviews.Content: For my daughter's birthday I prebooked and paid for a room a month ahead of her stay only to be informed at check-in that the specified room was not available due to renovations. If this situation had been known ahead of time another hotel would have been booked. This room was booked for my daughter and her husband who were coming from out of town for her birthday celebration. Their first night away since their daughter was born. They had dinner plans and were attending a show at the ACC so did not have the option of relocating to another hotel. Offered a room upgrade however, not quite sure just what the upgrade entailed since the room seemed pretty standard. Tub in bathroom not even deep enough for a good soak so decided to use the hot tub - OUT OF ORDER. Overall a special celebration, planned well in advance directly with the hotel, started off very badly and a so called room upgrade not adequate compensation for spoiling a very special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Worst front desk service from Paul & Leila”
Reviews.Author: salishangel
Reviews.Content: Worst customer service ever !!! I was not informed when I pre paid the room in Novemeber that I would be asked to pay an addtional $250.00 damage deposit. Upon arriving at the front desk , I was not greeted , only asked if I had a reservation , I answered yes and provided my name , Paul then indicated $250..00 is required or you can not stay here" I explained I was not informed of the deposit upon booking .Paul indicated " it's the hotel's policy ," I explained it's not written in stone . Oh, when I asked to see the policy in writing both Leila and Paul were raising their voices at me , I said only one person speak pls, Leila then said " well your daughter is over there being noisy"my grandaughter was 30 ft away from me , near her mom . .I said that doesn't mean you both have to raise your voice and speak to me at yhe same time. Paul then said " you cannot stay here without paying the deposit , you can go to an Inn down the street" when I walked away, my 22 yr old daughter said she was going to ask Paul & Leila something as I left to go to the car, as I walked away my daughter heard Paul out loud say " what a fkn bch " my daughter then walked back to Paul and said " ok the cusotmers may not always be right , but you should try to make it right for the customer" I admit I'm broke right now , I have been on sick leave since Sept with no pay, it's christmas , and this is the treatment we get from Paul & Leila from the Novotel In North York on Yonge st . I suggest you stay away form this hotel . Also they don't tell you about the parking fees being $ 17.50 a night . I don't know how this Novotel manages to stay open . The first stay there , the room was dusty , towels were hard, the room was noisy !! don't stay here if you want to enjoy a hotel !! worst in Toronto !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: FrankD750
Reviews.Content: Good value for the price. Hallways could be a bit cleaner or repainted. Room was very good. Roomy enough and well laid out. Great location, 20 minute walk to Rogers Centre, as we went to a Yankee/Blue Jays game, but any hotel near here is centrally located. Felt very safe walking the streets at night. Nice restaurants right across the street, and we found the Spaghetti Factory very reasonable. I would not recommend having breakfast at the hotel restaurant - , the food was good, but it was VERY expensive. There is a convenience store next to the hotel that is very reasonable, but they don't have any air conditioning at all and it's a bit run down. Would stay here again for a reasonably priced stay. Construction continues to be an issue, but it was not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place, if a tad expensive”
Reviews.Author: neilyork
Reviews.Content: I stayed in an Executive Room at the Novotel Toronto during a three day visit to the city. My room was on the eighth floor so I had good views and found the room to be very spacious with modern and functioning fittings. The free wi-fi was really what drew me to this hotel and I am pleased to say it worked flawlessly throughout my stay - isn't it awful that some hotels still charge up to Â£20 a day for this?! We arrived early at 10am and were allowed to check in even at this point which again was a huge bonus. Bizarrely there was a window between the bathroom and bedroom which was weird but hey ho.. Overall a nice place but at Â£150 per night B&B I felt it was just too over priced. A) It's still only a Novotel and B) there were other cheaper hotels closer to the City that I would imagine just as nice. But, would I stay here again? Yes, absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Stay Ok.”
Reviews.Author: ukads
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay here using Hotwire so didn't specifically choose this hotel. On arriving the underground car park $20 a night + tax was easy to find and had a lift connected to the hotel which was handy. At the reception desk I was told there were no doubles left (non smoking) and if I wanted double room then I would have to have a smoking room, so I took this option which wasn't ideal but hey. The staff I dealt with were all non Canadians and not particularly friendly. The room itself was ok. The lights surrounding the bed didnt work, the room was on the street side but there wasnt much light coming in. The room didn't smell too bad but there were lots of cigarette stains on the carpets and furniture. The bathroom from what I can remember was ok too. The bed was a good size and comfortable. Overall the room was reasonable but its a bit shabby round the edges. The swimming pool, gym and Hot tub were a bonus and pretty enjoyable to use. The hotel was covered by free wifi but unfortunately the signal on my floor just wasn't strong enough so I had to sit outside the lifts or downstairs in the lobby to use it. Overall the lobby and the outside of the hotel were very nice to look at but don't expect to much of the rooms. I would try somewhere different next time.

Reviews.Title: “very non smoking nightmare”
Reviews.Author: itaykadosh
Reviews.Content: Me and my fresh wife were in honeymoon - so that toronto was visited by us only for the purpose of u2 concert. the hotel location and the breakfast were very good, but those were the only good things that i have to say. the problems: we checked in on 7 pm, and were looking only for nice and clean room. we got 4 different rooms that were stinks from smoke (all of them were non-smoking) - the problem is that there is no windows in the rooms , and the air is moving in chaneels between the rooms. than when i was waiting for the bellboy - there wasnot one - so for the first time in my life i had to put by myself the bagages in the carrier and moved them to my room. i would have recommended only for smokers.

Reviews.Title: “Location...very good part of the stay. But will not be a first choice to stay.”
Reviews.Author: NChaff
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of it's close location to the Air Canada Centre. Considering we are only staying there to sleep after a concert, we didn't expect too much. The front desk staff were really nice (hotel didn't have bell hop though). The room was a pretty good size and the bed was comfortable. The room was a bit dark, only two working lamps in the room. The two light fixtures on the headboard, in my opinion did not serve any purpose. The bathroom was spacious but it had a tolerable stinky smell. The room and hotel common areas may need some renovation soon. It's clean but you can see that it's old. I didn't like that room service is only until 11pm. We didn't know about it until we got back from the concert and looking at the room service menu. It would have been nice to be told this information at check-in. Parking is $20. Not bad. All in all it was a decent hotel and served it's purpose to us.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: nuttymeg
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a flight from the UK only to find we had a problem with the adjoining family room, it was about 4 doors away! The girls moved in with their grandma for the first night, and the front desk staff were willing to move them onto a different floor the next day . We decided to leave them as they were in the end and cancel the extra room. The hotel staff were very professional and courteous at all times. The hotels strong point for us was its location. Easy walking to Union Stn, to the Lake, and up to Eaton Sq for shopping. Would reccommend the Spaghetti House for eating- right opposite the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It should not make a difference who you book through”
Reviews.Author: nysm192
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 10pm with a reservation for room with 2 queen beds. We were told they were all gone. We can upgrade you to a king bed. I am sorry but 2 straight males do not want to sleep in a king bed. My buddy had to sleep on cot and was very uncomfortable. Desk clerk did not seem to care if we were happy on not. I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay at the Novotel”
Reviews.Author: pandoras_chocolates
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference held at the Novotel Toronto Centre, and was following it up with a vacation with my spouse. The hotel is fairly conveniently situated, close to Union Station (about a 10-15 minute walk, less if you know your way around, which we do). The location is convenient to some nice restaurants, both chain and non-chain, some convenience stores, and coffee houses, but it's overall nothing special -- it's on the outskirts of downtown's financial district. But it's very easy to walk from the hotel to more interesting places, and there's the subway at Union Station. The hotel is very comfortable. We upgraded to an executive room, which was much quieter. The room was huge, with a big King-size bed, comfortable work area, big bathroom, and big windows. Everything was nicely decorated, clean, and worked. Staff were very friendly and accommodating, We didn't eat at the hotel (we know Toronto very well, and know where to go for good dinners), but the conference supplied breakfast via the hotel, and this was extensive and tasty. The meeting rooms at the hotel were large and worked well, but there was lots of construction nearby, and this noise was audible in the meeting rooms. The hotel staff were apologetic, but there was little they could do about it. Overall, we were very comfortable at the hotel. Apart from the little bit of construction noise during the day, it was very quiet (it's not on a particularly busy street), and staff were helpful. If you don't mind not being right in the centre of things (it's a 15 minute walk to the Eaton Centre, 15 minute subway ride to Bloor/Yonge), this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, no frills hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: GingerMax
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were visiting family in Kingston, from England, and had booked two nights stopover at the Novotel on the outward journey, and one night two weeks later on our return. We booked through Canadian Affair at the same time as our flights, and the price seemed very reasonable. We had noted some of the Tripadvisor comments - especially concerning building noise and car parking, but since we did not expect to be in during the day, and did not have a car, we were prepared to give it a go. The hotel is an older building with much more charm than the usual glass and metal lookalike monstrosities, and looks as though it should be situated on a tree-lined boulevard, possibly facing a nice park. It is, however, located in a slightly gloomy, unprepossessing backwater of a street between similarly miserable buildings. On our arrival there were two front desk staff on duty, and we were dealt with promptly and politely. We were immediately offered an upgrade to a higher spec. room for an extra $50 per night. We were told that this would include a free buffet breafast, which at $15.99 per person per day would make up for much of the extra cost, so we took this option. In common with most hotels we were asked for a credit or debit card to cover any additional expenses. Despite the lack of activity we were not shown to our room. The 9th (top) floor room was plainly decorated, but clean and with everything you could reasonably require. The bed was a very large double, and extremely comfortable. There was a television with a menu which immediately defaulted to the film options. There was at first a little confusion as to how it's menu system worked. There was a minibar which we had no intention of using, and a notice made it clear that it was not a fridge, and that any movement of the items in it, or of the bottled water would incur a charge. This could easily have been overlooked. There was a safe, large enough for a laptop, and a good bathroom with instant hot water. It was spotlessly clean. The view, from the back of the hotel was of a depressing multistorey car park with apartments above, but with the blinds closed it did not matter. The air conditioning system (essential) could be set to one's preference and worked perfectly. The inclusive buffet breakfast was excellent, with a really wide choice of everything imaginable, and as much as you could eat ! They advertise ' the best bread in town' and they are absolutely right. Suberb. The restaurant and bar staff were very friendly. The hotel has several hundred rooms, but it was not exactly vibrant with guests. Was this because it was unpopular, or just a slack midweek period ? However this did make our stay pleasantly peaceful. Some drilling noise started outside at 1000, but this had been notified to us, and was not too bad. The bar was expensive, as was the restaurant and 'Cafe Nichole', with a rather limited menu not to our taste, but there are very many places to suit all tastes nearby. There is a useful convenience store next door. The location is extremely convenient for all the downtown attractions, shops, restaurants and theatres, St. Lawrence Market, only two blocks away from the Union Station and minutes away from the CN Tower. Rooms have to be vacated by 1200, which is later than many, but when we told the desk staff that our train was not until mid-afternoon, they immediately told us we could retain the room until 1430 at no extra charge. When we checked out the first time, we noticed we had been charged for two films, which we had not watched, but had triggered due to unfamiliarity with the TV menu. We were told our bill would be amended, but we still got charged for one of them (about $14). We had made one phone call to our Kingston relatives, which turned out rather expensive. Beware not to use a Cash Passport (instead of credit card) to cover extras. Even if you do not incur any extra expenses, the hotel takes out a substantial amount straight away, then refunds it much later, leaving you short of cash for much of your stay. On our return for one night a fortnight later, we were allocated our 'standard' double room on the 7th floor. It was barely any different from the upgraded room we had used previously, except for being fractionally smaller, no glass table and curtains instead of blinds - which we preferred anyway. Our only critiscism was the slightly tired carpet. Everything else was identical, and otherise spotless. I think we had been ripped off with the upgrade. The daytime drilling noise seemed to have finished. We were much more careful with the TV menu this time ! The desk staff arranged a limo' type taxi to the airport at a flat rate of $55, and it arrived promptly. For short stays certainly, the Novotel is good value and excellently situated. I would use this hotel again, and recommend it to anyone unless they have very exacting standards and high expectations.

Reviews.Title: “A very big room in an enormous hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ALAISU
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine with the room, although it had some maintenance issues. Breakfast not included and very expensive. They tried to charge us one day before the checkout. When we checked out we found out that they had just put the bill on our credit card without telling us teh day before. The views from the room were awful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: rk200933
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel hidden on a quiet side street in downtown Toronto. Beautiful rooms, great fitness room and a breakfast to die for. Never have I stayed in a hotel with a hot and cold breakfast buffet included with the room. The free breakfasts are usually meager or the buffets cost $15, but this place was just wonderful. Close to shopping, waterfront, Hockey Hall of Fame, Skydome and the Air Canada Centre, pretty much everything you'd want to see in Toronto. The hotel was so discreetly placed that unless you went down the little street it's on, you wouldn't even know it was there. A classy and wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: 123456789Calgary
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel during a conference. Great location, friendly staff. One evening we came back to our room after a long day and house keeping had not been to our room to clean it. After phoning front desk to ask why, they were very quick to accommodate us, no questions just excellent customer service. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: cakeybees
Reviews.Content: We'd booked this hotel due to it's proximity to the Eaton Centre and the CN Tower. It's also a stones-throw from St Lawrence Markets (must try a peameal bacon roll) and all the night life of the Esplenade. We had a twin room, which was huge and had an equally over-proportioned bathroom. The hotel was spotless, the staff incredibly welcoming and friendly. It was a joy to stay at the Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rizuj
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the St Lawrence Market area - full of restaurants, a 24-hr supermarket, the Market itself, shops, and a Hop-on Hop-off bus stop virtually right outside. You can walk to the CN tower, Union station, Yonge St - very convenient indeed. The airport shuttle bus doesn't stop there however - if you take this bus, get off at the Westin and take a 5-minute taxi ride (or you can walk if you want; it's not far). The room was your standard Novotel room, spare but OK. Comfy bed and nice bathroom. Pretty quiet, too. The gym wasn't bad, I didn't see the pool. Hotel staff were helpful and efficient. The TV has an 'internet' service which really isn't worth it, but the hotel has free Wi-Fi throughout which is fantastic for someone unused to this service.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - good price”
Reviews.Author: TheGrub
Reviews.Content: All in all, this novotel hotel was good. good comfortable beds with decent size rooms. Location is great, about a 5 to 10 minute walk to the cn tower and eaton center. Insonorisation isn't the best.. but is ok. Carpet could be cleaner in the hallways and rooms...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Deanw291
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, and a very close walk to the main areas. The rooms are very spacious and clean. Very close walk to Church St and great Restaurants opposite the hotel. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FirefighersWife
Reviews.Content: I had read some mixed reviews on this hotel, but I booked hoping the bad reviews were flukes. And they were. I was very satisfied with our 2 night stay. There is, as others have stated, construction across the street. It really wasn't that loud, and we were out of the room most of the day, so it didn't bother us. I was checking in while my friend parked the car, so I don't have personal knowledge of the parking, but I heard it was scary. The room was very clean and we didn't have any problems with the staff. We booked this hotel because of its proximity to the Hockey Hall of Fame, and it was great. It is also within walking distance to pretty much everything. And try the Old Spaghetti Factory restaurant across from the hotel, very good and very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: MAZZ1969
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Expedia for a 6 night visit to Toronto. The room we had was a good size, clean and well maintained and the bathroom even had a small bath. Overall i thought the hotel, which is very handy for downtown Toronto and CN Tower/Rogers Centre was excellent value and would use again if for some reason i was in Toronto. There is (as other posters have noted) some building work taking place opposite the hotel, we had a room on the far side of the hotel away from the building work so it did not effect us, but it might be a problem if you did have a room nearer the building work. The Hotel also has free wifi, which was really handy as i had my ipod touch with me and i could check out the weather forcast when deciding what to do on each day of our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Booked online for cheap and it was worth it!”
Reviews.Author: kwamatu
Reviews.Content: We went to a concert at the Air Canada Centre. This hotel was maybe 2 - 3 blocks away, so it was within walking distance. Parking is a bit of a nightmare and it will cost you. Parking is underground. We used the underground machine and then told the front desk. I had to run back down and get the ticket off the dashboard for proof, then run the ticket back down to our car. Checking in took a while, but she was extremely patient and friendly with us and her computer. The room was clean, quiet, and easy to find. The restaurant was a bit overpriced so we just had burgers for 8 Canadian dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty overpriced hotel next to very noisy rail tracks”
Reviews.Author: Poetryprofessor
Reviews.Content: We have never stayed at Toronto Novotel before and wanted to try it out for a weekend. We always use the Novotel in Manhattan which is quite nice. However Toronto Novotel is getting old and needs some updates and good soundproofing. The room we were given was tired, wall material was peeling off and one light didn't work. There was a lot of dust under the beds... the place felt dingy and "unloved" I dont't think they are doing a good job, especially for the prices they are charging. We could hear the trains which was very unpleasant. For the price the Westin Harbor Castle is a much better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you could sleep in!”
Reviews.Author: K_Family_Travellers
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here for business on Apr 28th. I decided to take the trip out of town with him, and our 2 year old son to sleep in, go swimming and have some fun. First thing in the am we were woken up due to extremely loud construction. went to the pool at 10am and the hot tub was under construction, it completely terrified my son as it was very loud. We put our sons milk in the mini fridge, and we had to have the maid check that we didnt take anything, because soon as you move anything in it you are billed automatically. The hotel itself is completely fine as in cleanliness, value, and location, but just a heads up to those who are considering staying there right now while they are drilling, or jack hammering all over the place! Its definately not quiet starting at about 8 am! Also when I mentioned my concerns to the girl working the front desk, she completely acted clueless and surprised, nothing was done to compensate or rectify the situation.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: charlene82
