Reviews.Content: my friend and i were going to see a concert at the ACC and booked this hotel which is really close about 10min walk max. right across the street from union station which was really good since we went to toronto on the GO bus. pool is really small but there was never anyone there. the hot tub was under construction which was a disappointment. becareful with the mini bar, if you even move anything you will get charged if you need a fridge just ask and they will bring one up for you. there is a convience store right beside the hotel main entrance so get snacks there. room service:some stuff is reasonable, eg hamburger with fires $13. but for a bag of microwave popcorn and a pop was $9. a coke from the minifrige was $3.75. staff was very polite we arrived at 1pm and were not expecting to be able to get into our room but no problem not really busy season and this hotel seems to be out of the way of the main ones. i would recommend this hotel and i would stay in it again. price was the cheapest i could find in walking distance to ACC. there is construction right now and sign says from 8-6pm. i read the other reviews and i thought that people we just complaining about the noise but it is crazy lound. we only were bothered by it from 4-630pm and the next morning we were in the room unitl check out and hadn't heard a thing yet.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: wilsonWales
Reviews.Content: Just outside the main hustle and bustle ideal base ideally situated,excellent breakfasts to suit all tastes,healthy or cooked both excellent. Problem with conformation made booking via telephone but booked onto smoking floor with one bed instead of two,little bit of difficulty honouring our booking but did eventually,could have done without it after a long flight but when sorted no problems,make sure you get written conformation before arriving

Reviews.Title: “Try to avoid this hotel if you can.”
Reviews.Author: Endeee
Reviews.Content: As so many of the reviews here state, not the greatest hotel in the area for the star level. Pros - beautiful med. sized lobby, great location near great pubs and ACC, free wifi Cons - rooms quite dirty, bathrooms had mold on the ceilings, found glass shards unvacuumed on our carpet, unshampooed rug smelled of a spilled cup of coffee, alarm clock was not working, toilet had to be "flicked" in order to stop making a noise, construction next door, underground and across the alley sounded like it was right in the room next door ( I'm not EXAGGERATING here) and went on from 8am sharp until 6pm.) We pricelined so did well on price but even at that cheap rate, I'd pay more and stay elsewhere. I must say, it had the potential to be a good hotel but needs major TLC. The rooms look new but just unkept.

Reviews.Title: “Never going back again”
Reviews.Author: Morena83
Reviews.Content: We've had so many issues, where to begin? We chose Novotel Toronto because it wasn't too expensive and was conveniently located. When we first came in, their automatic doors were out of order so I struggled to get in. As we took the elevator we noticed that it wasn't going anywhere, they forgot to tell us that we had to insert our room key. We found hairs on the bathroom floor which weren't ours. The rest of the room was clean enough and well decorated. The view from our room sucked, it looked over a building in construction. When we got to the pool, we were disappointed. It was a lot smaller than it appeared on their website. It was clean and all just a lot smaller than pools in other hotel we've visited. As we went to our car, we notice that they had given us a parking ticket even though we had registered the car. When we explained the situation to the front desk, the employee said that they must have made a mistake and that she would take care of it. When we asked her name, she refused and gave us the hotel's phone number. When we got back to our room, we got bombarded by construction noises. It was so loud that my partner and I couldn't even hear ourselves speak. We called the frontdesk to know what the fuss was about and they said that they were undergoing construction in the underground parking and told us to be comprehensive. When I asked him why we were not informed, he simply said that we should be patient. I asked him when the renovations should be completed he asked us when we were planning on leaving the hotel. I replied the next day and he said that it shouldn't bother us all that much then. I insisted and he said not before at least a month. What really annoyed me was the fact that he was borderline arrogant. Once we came back we realized that we got charged 40$ for parking and nobody ever mentionned it. Should you be looking for a peaceful hotel with courteous client service then think twice before making reservations at the Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Pits.”
Reviews.Author: liviadia
Reviews.Content: We reserved a king bed and were given a queen smoking room. It took some pleading for them to honor our reservation. They ended up kicking someone off their reservation to give us the room we reserved. The rooms were very creepy and filthy. Despite online details about updated rooms with modern touches, the rooms were smelly and decrepid. Parking was a rip off and our SUV did not fit in the nearby lot. Morning coffee in the lobby was $2. The resturant prices were beyond astronomical and we chose to eat all our meals elsewhere. Other than their pet-friendly policy ($35 non-refundable fee) I am not sure why anyone would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for parking garage”
Reviews.Author: Pushing50Ny
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, great location, reasonable price, BUT the parking garage experience ruined it for us. Vehicle vandalized, window smashed, ransacked, stole license plates. Spent 6 hr in hotel lobby waiting for police report and new window for vehicle. Hotel staff were not supportive and never offered us even a water bottle in those 6 hr. Talking to others revealed that this theft is an ongoing problem. Hotel did credit the $20 parking fee. We suggest you spend your money at hotels with surveillance cameras in parking area.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay if you're going to a Leaf game- close to the ACC.”
Reviews.Author: JustBeachyNovember
Reviews.Content: We had tickets to the Maple Leaf vs Senators game Jan 3/09. We chose the Novotel because it is a short walk to the Air Canada Centre. We had a room on the 7th floor with a comfortable king sized bed. It was not a huge room but ok for the 2 of us. The room, including the bathroom, was very clean and modern and everything worked great. The people at the front desk were great. The only negative about the hotel was the parking. When we booked we were told it was included in the price but we were charged $20. The parking is underground and it is so tight! I'm glad we have a smaller vehicle. We had to wait for someone to leave before we could park. My husband had to help guide that vehicle out so he didn't hit anything, then I had to do the same to get ours parked. I come from a small town where parking is not an issue, so I find that a bit stressful, but once we were parked we could walk everywhere we had to go so that was good. Other than the parking, our stay at the Novotel was great, the Maple Leafs beat the Senators, and we really enjoyed our time in Toronto! I would definitely stay at the Novotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, worst parking set up ever.”
Reviews.Author: psujack2007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in downtown Toronto with restaurants, bars, stadiums, theater, etc. all nearby. Staff is well trained and rooms are well appointed. They absolutely need to get a valet service going!! The hotel parking is a disaster!! The single worst parking set up I have seen in 25 years of travelling and I travel 100 times per year. Get the valet set up tomorrow. I mean it............. Do it!.............Am I being clear?? Other than that, it is reasonably priced, has a restaurant and bar, a pantry and all the other amenities you could want on a business trip. I would stay here again, but not until they establish a valet service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scotsman2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights as the third leg of our honeymoon and found the hotel to more than live up to our expectations. We were upgraded to a "Superior" room with a glorious super-kingsize bed, large bathroom (with electric blind!) and all the usual facilities. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The hotel is ideally located for sightseeing Toronto City Centre and a perfect base for seeing the surrounding area of the Lakes. Budget Car Hire is a 5 minute walk away as is the train station which has a covered walkway directly to the CN Tower. Very pleased with the Novotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: seanavon
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Novotel Toronto Centre for 11 nights in November and had no complaints whatsoever. The staff were all very helpful. The housekeepers were great and worked around my schedule, the concierge was excellent with helping me find the places I needed to go to and suggesting activities to occupy my spare time. The hotel itself is centrally located in downtown Toronto with everywhere you might want to go in walking distance or just a quick subway ride away. There are several very nice restaurants and pubs very close to the hotel as well, making dining choices varied on many nights. The room was tastefully decorated and had more then enough space in it for me. Although I only used the pool, hot tub and exercise room sparingly, they were more then adequate for my needs. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Toronto as the staff are great and helpful, the facilities are more then adequate and the location cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Located”
Reviews.Author: IsleofWightGolfer
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay and matched up to the previous visits despite the significant construction work taking place across from the main entrance. The reception staff were very helpful and room was functional and clean. The swimming pool area looked slightly tired but nevertheless for the rate paid I was pleased to make use of it after a long day of sight seeing and on all occasions had it totally to myself. The hotel's main plus is its location being within a few minutes easy walking distance to buses, train, ferries, shops and the CNTower/Rogers Centre - ideal. It is not an upmarket place but very functional and I left feeling I had got value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A Huge Letdown”
Reviews.Author: isis1969
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel during Caribana with my mother and children. To say that the photos on the 'net overblew how well this hotel is would be an understatement. To start with, my first impression of the hotel was a bit disappointing. The front check in person was a bit full of himself and acted as though he was doing me a favor by "allowing" me to stay in their hotel. I thought, well it is a busy weekend and maybe he was tired from the activity as we were checking in about 3pm. When we arrived to the floor of our hotel room I could smell cigarettes, odd because I was told I would be on a non-smoking floor. The hallway was dimly lit and once in the room I was shocked at the relative cramped space and the view of the construction and restaurant outside of my window was disheartening. It was not centrally located to the parade route as I was told and was again put off by the staffs lack of knowledge. The concierge, questionable at best if that is what she was, had a bad attitude towards certain tourists and gave me the impression that this hotel was not as "cosmopolitan" as it appeared in the advertisements. She acted as though I was invisible and did not offer anymore knowledge than what I could have picked up in the brochures provided in the lobby. I originally chose this hotel because I felt it was a nice place to stay for my children and mother but in hindsight would have chosen one of the more popular hotel chains and may have gotten what I expected. The price was neither here nor there but I would definitely rethink before staying at this location again. Maybe for a weekend tryst this hotel is suitable but anything beyond that would not be reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: EmilyCW
Reviews.Content: Through an online booking site, I pre-paid for a standard, 2 Queen Bed room. On arrival, there was one person manning the Front Desk, and a line up of 7 or 8 people waiting to check in. Front Desk advised me that there were no 2 Queen Bed rooms remaining. It felt like I was in a Seinfeld episode, as I questioned the front desk : how could there be no more 2 Queen Bed rooms left when I made my reservation 3 months ago and pre-paid for them? Although he wasn't rude, he was altogether unhelpful. I was given a room with a double bed and a pull-out couch. I've slept on bunk beds more comfortable than that pull-out. I put my make-up bag on the counter and accidentally knocked over the 2 water bottles on sensors. Next thing I know, I see 2 water bottles on my bill which the Front Desk did not mention on checkout; I noticed it when I had to specifically request the hotel receipt. Again at check-out, another line of 7 or 8 people waiting with one person manning the Front Desk. I was shocked that there was no in-room Checkout system in place. Since we had to stay in a substandard room, I asked for free parking [one night = $20]. (Note: This was not offered and Front Desk was waving me away without further attempt to rectify the situation). My request was refused and I was given a free continental breakfast, which I turned down since there are much better places to eat nearby. I used to live in Toronto and for a tourist, it may be okay, particularly if you are on a budget and don't mind a bit of walking. It's close to St. Lawrence Market, the ACC, CN Tower, Skydome (now Rogers Centre) and the Hummingbird Theatre. In the summer, it's about a 10 minute walk to the Lakeshore and Union Station {subway, train and GO station}. Being that I am originally from Toronto, I am disappointed and embarrassed of such pettiness displayed. I would hate for a traveler to get the wrong impression that Novotel exemplifies typical Canadian / Toronto customer service. I would consider this a budget hotel, for to the poor customer service and limited facilities. Another reviewer got it right, when he/she said this location is trying to be more upscale than it is. The photos are more impressive than they are in in-person. If you are looking at paying over $170 a night, I'd suggest finding another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Paige10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel In April for a week. I chose this hotel because of the reviews and how close it was to attractions. This hotel is a great base to see Toronto. We were able to walk everywhere, the only time we used the underground is when we went to the Zoo. Did not eat in the hotel but there are plenty of places near by to eat. We got a taxi from the airport it think it was about 48 dollars. Would recommend this hotel to anyone, it was comfy, clean and a good size. They also had many good facilities, and the staff were frinedly to.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Downtown Toronto Option”
Reviews.Author: Infiniti
Reviews.Content: Overall, not a bad hotel to stay at. Some of the attractive features included free wireless internet (unusual in an upper scale hotel), efficient front desk service, and a good location near the waterfront with plenty of lively eating and drinking spots nearby. The bathroom fixtures were very new, and the bed cover was an attractive off-white. The bed itself was quite comfy. I had one meal at the Cafe Nicole in the hotel lobby, and the service and food was above average. However, the Novotel does have its challenges. Some of the irritating feartures of the hotel: 1. I had a horribly dirty carpet in my room. 2. The toilet seat would not stay up, creating a risk of surprise strikes against sensitive body parts. 3. The view from my 3rd floor window was a....wall. I'm sure some prison cells have better views. 4. No newspaper delivered to my room in the morning, and none available at the front desk. Apparently you need to pay more for an Executive Room to get a newspaper. The Novotel is a viable option in downtown Toronto, especially if your are not expecting 5-star surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: MAMP
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were in town for a ballgame, some good food and fun! The hotel was in walking distance to the ballgame and great places to eat. We were able to walk around and get back with no trouble at all. It was very clean and quiet! The buffet was well worth the price. It had everything on it. The rooms are very modern, so there was not a lot of drawer space, but I hung most of my things and it worked out. The bathroom was huge and very clean. I would recommend this hotel. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ranpol
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more then excellent, I cant describe how good this hotel was, this was by far the best hotel I have ever stayed at. the staff at this hotel was Phenomenal and would do everything possable to make sure we were comfortable. The rooms were very clean and well put togeather. the restaurant was very good and breakfast was also excellent. The hotel was right in downtown toronto, a block away from the Hockey Hall Of Fame and about four blocks from the CN Tower and the Rogers Centre. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Toronto, and I would 100% stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware at check-in”
Reviews.Author: LCMike
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel, reasonably well located in Toronto for downtown activities, however, upon check-in despite reserving a room with two doubles/queens for three people, the clerk tried to sell us on a room with one bed and a trundle. After repeated insistence that this was unacceptable for us, he asked us to take a look at the room. Not only was the 2nd bed too small and uncomfortable for our teenage son, but the room itself was tiny. We returned to the desk and the clerk tried to get us to take the room by offering us free breakfasts, then finally acquiesced and gave us a very nice, spacious room with two beds of the size needed. We were satisfied with our stay after that, but it's too bad a good stay at a decent hotel got off on the wrong foot because a clerk was trying to "do the right thing for the hotel," as he put it. I'm not sure how you can do the right thing for the hotel if you're disappointing and irritating a guest, but that's what happened. Also, construction was underway across the street so you might want to check on the status of that before making your reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, But a little Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: PJCTraveler
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with this hotel, but felt that it was a little overpriced. The hotel appeared to be trying to be a little higher-class than it really was. The staff was not super friendly and seemed put out when we asked for information and directions. Our room was nice, but had a bit of an odd smell and needed to be vacuumed much better. We could hear every word that was said in the room next to us, which was only a problem at 2AM when the "girls" returned from their night on the town. The location is great. We attended at concert at the Sony Centre, which is literally across the street. I would probably stay here again, but not at $250 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, just 2 blocks from a subway station”
Reviews.Author: JanS3
Reviews.Content: We booked our 4 night stay from the UK and paid upfront for the deal. Fortunately we were in Toronto 4 weeks earlier and checked out the hotel as there was heavy construction work being carried out opposite the hotel entrance. We managed to arrange to be allocated a room away from this and on a high floor, which was great as we did not experience any outside noise much at all. We were happy with our room and the breakfast buffet in the restaurant had an amazing choice. The staff in the restaurant were very helpful. We also enjoyed a couple of evening meals in the restaurant. The hotel was in a good location, just one block from Yonge Street and 2 blocks from a subway station. We would certainly consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: jl21Va
Reviews.Content: The hotel seemed to be trying to present itself as an upscale, European atmosphere - but really it just meant that they overcharged and were rude. The highlight was carrying sleeping children down 5 flights of stairs at 3am due to a fire alarm. There were several other people walking down with us and it took us about 15 minutes to find the well obscured fire exits. They did very little to help us and never made any attempt to improve our stay after we spent 30 minutes in the street with our kids. When checking out the clerk asked how my stay was and I said... "ok, I guess... average?" fairly sarcastically to which no response was made. Anyway... it was close to HHOF which is why we chose it. It was good for that.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, very good service”
Reviews.Author: tonythetiger51
Reviews.Content: Good location, comfortable and very friendly service, particularly in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Accomodations...Not a Great View...Best for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Tanya K
Reviews.Content: Our room was average- VERY CLEAN, nothing fancy. This hotel was quiet and probably more suited towards business travelers. The hotel was nice overall, but I was disappointed in the services for families. No play areas or arcade for the kids. If you are staying in Toronto to go sightseeing and roam around all day like we did, you won't be disappointed. The pool and spa were a little grungy, but they were open until 11pm. The fitness center was very nice- we didn't use it, though. The restaurant's breakfast buffet was a super deal- kids under 16 ate free and the food and coffee were great! The construction across the street from our room was definitely a negative, as were the gleaming neon lights from the Old Spaghetti Factory's sign. However, it is a 5 minute walk to the St. Lawrence Market and many, many bars and restaurants . It was located at the southermost point of Yonge Street off the beaten path. Quick walk to Yonge Street and subways, but not close to the mall. I actually preferred that because it was quieter at night. We stayed here because we got a great deal through Priceline.com, but I don't think I would choose to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great for pet owners!”
Reviews.Author: bricksclick
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel with my 65-lb. senior dog and it was a very positive experience. The Novotel truly was pet friendly, and Charlie was given a doggie gift bag upon check in. The housekeeping staff was very friendly with our dog and he was allowed to ride the elevators and stroll through the lobby as if he were canine royalty. There are two or three grassy park-like areas nearby, too, for walking your pooch. Highly recommended hotel for folks who travel with their dogs.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Public Transportation - Construction Across the Street”
Reviews.Author: msbianca2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good. I only stayed for a night. It's a couple blocks from Union Station and the Subway line. I had a fairly large room with minimum European decor. This is a perfect place to stay if youâ€™re going to be out and about all day. One downside, there is construction going on directly across the street (the streets are close in this area). The banging and noise began exactly at 7:30 a.m. I think this is something they should make there guests aware of upon booking or checking-in. Had I had a longer stay, I would have asked to be moved immediately. Other than that, it was a good hotel if you get a good deal. Don't overpay though.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel for couples”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaHockeymom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for two nights in January. We booked a standard room with two Queen beds and we asked for a rollaway. When we arrived we were told they had no rollaways and that the room would not accomodate one anyway. When we got to the room we saw why. One queen bed and a day bed. Had I know this ahead of time, I may not have booked this hotel. There were five of us - 2 adults and 3 kids. We were coming off a week long trip in Ottawa, so by the time we put our luggage in the room there was barely room for us. Luckily we had our days totally planned out so we wouldn't spend too much time in the room. The best part of the hotel was it's location. We were within walking distance of the places we wanted to visit. It was only a ten minute walk to catch the Maple Leafs game at the Air Canada Centre. Five minutes to the Hockey Hall of Fame where we spent the whole day. We are from California, so walking around town while it is snowing was fun for us. Back to the hotel for a late night swim...or not. The pool area was basic at best. The chlorine smell was enough to change your mind about going in. We only stayed for a few minutes then went back to our tiny room. I will say the hotel restaurant was nice. The server we had took really good care of us. The hotel itself was not bad, just not great for a family as large as ours. I feel that we were mislead during our reservation of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Standing Novation!”
Reviews.Author: chovaleoni
Reviews.Content: Not only did I get an amazing deal, the accommodations far exceeded my expectations. Bright, modernist and newly renovated, the room was immaculate. The cozy bed w/down comforter tempted me to sleep in all day, but since the location was within walking distance from several great restaurants, the Air Canada Centre, Hockey Museum and many other attractions, it was easy to resist that urge. The workout room had ellipticals with flat screens, weights and ample equipment, with a spacious pool, hot tub and sauna nearby. Overall, a five star hotel experience for the price of a one star. Without hesitation, go enjoy yourself at the Novotel - it rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: manny_83
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay here. Basically there was a large group of 10 guys out to party and have a good time from the UK. The staff had no problem giving us rooms next to each other which we preferred. As we could jump in and out of each others rooms if we needed anything. A short walk up to the Eaton Centre and Yonge street. Directly across the road there are a couple of nice restaurants and bars. I liked the bar which has world beers. Coming from the UK, I was estatic that they had a lovely cold pint of Kronenbourg 1664. Quite pricey tho as most beers are imports. If you take a right coming out of the hotel and then the next left, you'l find 'the keg' steakhouse'. This is a fantastic place to eat, so many steaks and options. Enjoyed our stay here. Only problem was that as we were in and out of our rooms alot the doors did make a large sound when being left to close. Thats the only 'negative' thing I have to say. It didn't matter to us but perhaps other guests may not have liked it. Overall a very good place to stay and on the 1st floor they also have one pc so you can check online etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Pascal G
Reviews.Content: very good hotel and great location. It is right in the centre and only few minute walk from main attractions! I recommend taking breakfast at the Rich Trees.. 4 min walk from the hotel and such a fresh food for a reasonnable price! Hotel has a top floor swimming pool with a fantastic view on Toronto! Don't miss it! The gym is also the largest I have seen in Novotel and well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “we liked it!”
Reviews.Author: doomdoom
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine, a little in need of a makeover perhaps, but in a nice way.... kinda Art Deco Faded Grandeur. It was clean and comfortable. The location is ok, near theatre land and St Lawrence market (worth a visit) Easy walk to the railway station but BEWARE - if you need a cab to the station you may have problems. The rather unhelpful frontdesk staff refused to call us a cab, said they wouldnt do such a short trip and advised us to walk... Great fun, with 3 suitcases and 2 sets of skis! The rest of the staff were nice though, the restaurant was surprisingly good. The room was spacious, comfortable, nice big beds, good bathroom, coffe making, free wifi, excellent room service. But beware the mini bar - real rip off prices. So over all, a couple of problems but still good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: southboundman
Reviews.Content: Visited here in September 2001 - sorry for the delay in the revue Ha! Ha! This hotel is ideally situated for yonge st. shopping and all the downtown amenities are within walking distance ie shops,harbour area for island trips,cn tower,stadium and pubs etc. The hotel itself is of a high standard and rooms, food etc are top class. There is a penthouse-type jacussi and pool and steam room etc. free for residents and there are eateries and pubs across the road with live music and excellent food. They also do daily coach trips to Niagara and surrounding districts.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pats11fan
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and nicely decorated, however the beds were extremely uncomfortable! The location cannot be beat, especially if you plan on visiting the Hockey Hall of Fame or attending an event at the Air Canada Center. The restaurant inside the hotel has decent food and the room service was quick. The area around the hotel is very quite, clean and appeared to be safe. I would definitely stay at the Novotel again when visiting Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Won't hurry back”
Reviews.Author: traveldivaMI
Reviews.Content: On the bad side: Parking is almost $20 per day. The beds are horrendously uncomfortable. The housekeeping staff ignores the "Do Not Disturb" sign. Room decor is outdated and furniture is very worn. Their "Novation" concept definitely needs work. I booked a discount package deal (two nights plus buffet breakfast each morning) through the hotel's own website and when we got there, they claimed to not have our reservation in the computer. Luckily, I had my confirmation email and they had to give us the discounted rate I had booked (through their own website!). Apparently, when packages change they simply delete the old reservations for the packages that have ended out of their system. Don't try to check in without your confirmation number! We also did not get the breakfast we were expecting :( Oh, and worst of all - they cheated us (nearly $20) on a currency exchange. We had no idea until we were out and about on the town (will admit we should have done some research first, but who would have thought the hotel would be so underhanded?) Exchange your money at a bank or at the border - don't do it at this hotel! The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is very nicely located and is within walking distance of just about everything you would want in downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: EssexMichael
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to where the airport coach drops you (Union Station) and so has easy access to the subway. There is an impressive lobby but rooms although spacious seem rather dull. They do however have everything you would need, and have spacious bathrooms too. The hotel has a decent sized pool and a well equiped gym that hardly ever got busy. Within a few minutes you can be in the centre of the shops but good restaurants seemed to be a few blocks further. The CN Tower is only a few blocks away, along with the Hippo Tours and the stadium. Breakfast was average at the hotel (buffet style) but you can easily walk to some great breakfast places.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BurinNlAwayfromhome
Reviews.Content: Great acommodations.Staff very helpful.Arrived early and had luggage stored away until room was ready.Wonderful dining in hotel restaurant.Close to Air Canada Center,Hall Of Fame,and lots of dining & clubs within walking distance.Greeting staff very obliging in providing directions to requested venues.Hotel host excellent atitude even went outside to hail Taxi cab for us to go to hockey game at Ricoh Center.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: Exhausted_7
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel for 2 nights. I pre-booked on expedia and reserved a non-smoking room. After arriving at the hotel, I was told that the non-smoking room which I had reserved was not available and that they had to put me on a smoking floor. I was not happy about this and I was not given any other option than to stay in a smoking room. After walking into the room, I was disgusted to see that the room had a horrible stench to it. Not only that, the carpets were stained all over the room and there were cigarette burns in the carpet. I immediately returned to the front desk where they moved me to another room. This room was almost equally as bad as it too had cigarette burns in the carpets and stains on the floor. That night, I ended up sleeping in that room fully clothed as I was disgusted and uncomfortable with my sleeping arrangements. Hotel staff tried to be as accomodating as possible, but in the end, it is the room that ruined my whole stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: jinman72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for nearly a week. During that time, we found the staff to be very welcoming and friendly, especially in the Dining Room, where the Buffet Breakfast ($14.95+taxes) was delicious with plenty of it. Previous reviewers said there were problems with smelly sewers in the area, that is true to a degree when heading towards the nearby bus station, but not evident within the close vicinity to the hotel.Would definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: tripster21
Reviews.Content: Great Place to Stay! The staff was extremely helpful during my first visit to Toronto. We arrived before check in and they held our luggage in a secure place for us as we toured the city. The staff was extremely helpful with directions! The hotel is in a great location for downtown Toronto. There are many local pubs and restaurants within a short walk. St.Lawarence Market is a five minute walk from the hotel and Scotland Yard is a great pub with great food and is located right across the street from the hotelThe rooms were wonderful and the bathrooms are first class. All rooms have wireless internet connection. Great exercise room! Upon checking out we rode a cab to the airport for only $40.00 which was well worth since we didn't have to get on the subway and then take a shuttle to the airport. Overall the hotel was much nicer than we had expected considering the price per night. I would highly recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: MiMi58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Toronto Centre for 4 nights in September and thought it was a terrific hotel for the money. We liked the fact that it was a smaller hotel on a relatively quiet street (for Toronto). The room was spacious and well maintained. The AAA rate I was able to get, while not a bargain, seemed reasonable for the quality of the hotel and location. The hotel is a 10 minute walk to the lake and the St. Lawrence Market. While many of the restaurants we were interested in were not in the immediate area, they were all a relatively short cab ride away. The breakfast buffet is expensive but the hotel is flexilbe, for example allowing guests to just get cereal or cereal and a sweet roll from the buffet for a much reduced price. We would stay at this hotel again and definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Toronto Centre is ok”
Reviews.Author: Sacchini
Reviews.Content: I stayed only one night at Novotel City Centre but I really enjoyed about it. Near to every tourist relevant location. Clean and comfortable, Fast and efficient staff. Good services (WiFi connection to Internet, pool, gym, limo, ...). Really recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable hotel”
Reviews.Author: penylan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Toronto Novotel as part of a 2 week stay in eastern Canada. We got a deal a deal through Airmiles which is the main reason why we booked it. We had modest expectations having read the reviews and knowing Novotel's brand. The hotel turned out to be perfectly acceptable, although it felt a bit tired and not as clean as we would have liked. Our room was comfortable enough, with the bed being perhaps the best feature. Our room was quiet, we did not notice any noise from construction works or railway lines. The location was fine, with the real bonus of being so close to the amazing St Lawrence Market which is an ideal location for breakfast or lunch. We found the best local place to eat was the Sultan's Tent, 5 minutes walk from the hotel. It is Moroccan food at its best.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: chiefad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the novotel for 3 nights and found it very quiet and comfortable with very helpful staff. The room was slightly on the small side but the location so near the St Lawrence Market and the waterfront more than made up for this with may excellent bars and restraunts nearby

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: babydrag0n
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the previous reviews about construction work opposite the hotel we were a little concerned. Good news was that we never heard a thing from within the hotel. The location is excellent. It is not bang in the centre of the city, but you'll find that is within easy walking distance of all the major attractions, whether you want to go down to the Harbourfront, the Entertainment District or the main downtown shopping area. No problems with cleanliness, maintenance, amenities or size of room. Buffet breakfast was great. The selection of bread was unrivalled. Never had an evening meal in the restaurant. The menu looked a little limited and there were plenty of other restaurants nearby to chose from.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Staff not so much”
Reviews.Author: SimplyHonest
Reviews.Content: 2 adults travelling with 2 teens. Nice room. Nice amenities. Did not try the restaurants. Kids enjoyed pool and exercise room. Asked staff at reception desk for information on different occasions and except for 1 of the staff members, they never greet you with a : Good morning, can I help you? no smiles. They don't look like they enjoy the job... well... that's too bad for them. Proximity of small restaurants nearby (not too pricy either) was appreciated. Proximity, walking distance, of major attractions as well as streetcars, subway and busses.. a plus. in all, we didn't let the attitude of the staff dampen our stay in To. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good overall”
Reviews.Author: potsieman
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel!] The hotel would be better in a better part of town. You could smell the sewer alot in the blocks surrounding the hotel as you walked around. Lots of pubs nearby which is nice but also leads to a few drunks on the streets. ALWAYS felt safe though. The rooms are very nice and the hotel is very safe. Nice pool for the kids. You need a hotel key to work the elevator which is nice. IT IS TRUE what they say about the H2O and bar fridge on sensors so DO NOT TOUCH THEM. TIP: ASk for a fridge in your room so you do not use the bar fridge for your own juice/water/beer. Duvet covers were nice and the air conditioner was VERY quiet. Always clean and neat in appearance. Never tried the breakfast though. TIP: Nice ham/eggers two doors down at the market for breakfast at $3 each. A 24hr market is 2 blocks up and 2 blocks to the right to fill the fridge and for snacks/bread. Would stay again but the smells were a little uninviting outside

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: Otis_Cooney
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed 2-day stay as part of our honeymoon. Arrived on Thursday prior to check in time. Did not have our room ready, but we took room with 2 queens instead of 1 king. Staff was friendly and helpful at check in, directing us to underground parking lot. Lot was tight and a little expensive ($20 CDN/night) but it was worth it. Upon arriving in our room, noticed the TV didn't work. Contacted front desk and within 15 minutes, maintenance was in the room and corrected the problem immediately. Room did face the condo construction that has been mentioned in other reviews. Some noise could be heard, but nothing significant at all. Many nearby restaurants, we enjoyed the Old Spaghetti Factory right across the street. Have eaten at other OSFs and this fell in line with those -- good food at a budget price. Room service seemed reasonably priced too but we didn't try it. Within walking distance of CN Tower (the 360 restaurant is expensive but worth it for a couple who plans on going to the top of the tower anyway). Also can walk to the ballpark on secured, covered PATH walkway. Two blocks from Hockey Hall of Fame -- a must for any hockey fan! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: leche71
Reviews.Content: The location was great, convenient to everything. We walked to the CN Tower, only 10 minutes away. We also took a double decker tour bus ride which picked us up right in front of the hotel, I recommend doing it, its fun and you get to see alot of Toronto and you can decide where you want to get off. We got off and did some shopping and we saw a cool castle and went to a museum, had lunch and then went back to the hotel. The hotel is located right across the street from a restaurant called The Old Spaghetti Factory. I had read that this place was good, but I was totally disappointed, I think people go there to look around because of the cool decorations. The food is only okay. My friend ordered scallops in the hotel restaurant and she said they were delicious. The room was nice. Big, fluffy pillows and the sheets were soft. High speed internet was really fast, $10 a day though. Bathroom was spotless and lots of soaps, lotions, and shampoos. The towels were soft and big too. I liked it alot, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: jojo75
Reviews.Content: We went to Toronto as part of our Honeymoon and stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The reception staff were very helpful and when we asked they gave us a free upgrade. We loved our room, even if it didn't have a good view. Much larger than a standard room, nice flat screen TV and a rain shower. Very modern and totally spotless! Very comfortable large bed as well. The hotel is in easy walking distance of the waterfront by lake Ontario and easy walking distance to city centre. We loved the buffet breakfast. Loads of choice and good quality food. Our server/waiter was so friendly, just what you want a cheerful face in the morning! The only thing that wasn't so good was the hotel swiming pool in need of an update and clean. Also lots of very loud unsupervised children in it! Overall I would highly recommend this hotel if you are planning a short trip to Toronto. By the way the Nigara falls are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: chefDC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for four days. This hotel reminded us of some of the European hotels we stayed at. The room was on the smaller size and the decor was modern/urban. The room and the bathroom were clean, though the tub had marks of wear and tear. As a previous reviewer stated, there were gaps around the door so that you could hear hallway noise. The hotel was within a walking distance to all the main attractions. We did have to pay for parking, but compared to other cities we visited, we found the $18.00 a day reasonable. Unlike a previous reviewer who stated that he/she paid $300.00 for the room, we paid $160 and this included the breakfast buffet for two. So, obviously, you need to make sure that you get the best deal there is. Our only gripe was that we reserved a room facing the back of the building, but when we arrived, we were told that they don't necessarily honor such requests and that they did not have these rooms available. When we showed our confirmation email, the person at the front desk began to argue. We ended up with a room facing the front but on the far side of the building. So, the noise from the construction site was minimal.

Reviews.Title: “great Local, great bfast- that's it!”
Reviews.Author: jenofa
Reviews.Content: I should of known when I called to book a room and got a run around with different prices from those shown on line. Things only got worse when I got to the hotel. The concierge were all rude, treated me like dirt, as if I was bothering them by asking questions. The room was old and out dated, there were no sheets on our bed. We had to pay $20 for one night of parking on top of the $300 for the room ( a very small one queen size bed room). Any time we asked something of the front desk we were made to feel bad. They do have a great restaurant with great friendly staff and a fabulous buffet breakfast. The location is ideal, but there are plenty of others within walking distance for the same price. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kgrif40
Reviews.Content: We used airmiles for this hotel and it was a great place to stay for a couple of nights in Toronto. It is within walking distance of all the main sights. I was concerned about the building work going on opposite the hotel but we couldn't hear it from the room at all and it didn't cause us any inconvenience whatsoever. The rooms are great although we assumed that the water was complimentary and it isn't, so be careful!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this VERY Dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: David_Mina
Reviews.Content: Dirty older hotel. Booked a room there for us and kids. Parking was very expensive. Room was disgusting - small pieces of hair on the floor and on the bathroom baseboards, Even on the pillows Towels had yellow stains - horrible ! Absolutely Not clean. Called front desk and they didn't send anyone. Called again - they said they were busy !!! We came by and demanded manager - were told none was available, but they gave us new towels... We moved out next day. David & Mina

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: RinMachen
Reviews.Content: Initially my wife and I were wary of booking a Novotel as they generally have a poor reputation, thanks to the ones we've come across in France. This one, however, is one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in. The location of the hotel is superb, being only minutes away from Union Station, the CN Tower, Waterfront and St Lawrence Market. The staff of the hotel were thorough, professional and very friendly. The room (and bed) was absolutely huge, spotlessly clean and despite the hotel's proximity to the railway line, extremely quiet. Although we paid a little bit more than we would normally to stay here it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyBonkers
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in June and it was wonderful! The location was great - right behind the Hummingbird Centre, down the street from St Lawrence Market - and it had a lovely row of restaurants and bars across the street. The room and bathroom were clean, very spacious and beautifully decorated and we had a nice view of the street below. The staff were very nice and the concierge was extremely helpful when we were looking for advice on trips and things to do. You can buy tickets for the city bus tour here and there even is a bus stop right outside the hotel door! Toronto is a magical city - and has so many different places to explore! Must see is St Lawrence Market - have some crepes for breakfast! We had a fantastic time - June is a great time to go as the weather was hot and sunny for the 6 days that we were there - and can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Novotel”
Reviews.Author: NateAlaska
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Novotel for three days this April. The lobby and rooms were clean and everything appeared to be newly renovated. They have Wi-Fi in the rooms and the room safes are large enough for laptops. I like to workout when traveling and was impressed with their gym. Normally, hotel gyms are usually an afterthought but they had numerous cardio and weight machines and several TVs. They also have a pool and a hot tub. If you need to park, there's a public garage that is right behind the hotel. St. Lawrence Market is just a block or so away from the hotel - it's a neat market that is a great place to get a cheap breakfast or lunch. There are also a number of bars and restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. My only gripe is that there is a bit of a gap between the room door and the floor. Therefore, you can hear those who are out in the hallway. Regardless, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdamfamily
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 1:30 pm and realized that our room may not be ready. My sister and her family had also booked a room adjacent to ours. One room was ready and one was not. The clerk suggested "family rooms" that were immediately available. This consisted of a queen bed and a trundle bed. Our kids were thrilled. However at about 1am when our youngest crawled in bed with us I retreated to the couch portion of the trundle bed. I was less than comfortable. The next night the kids stayed put and they had no complaints regarding comfort. The staff was always polite and helpful and even called my husband by name without asking for his room number. The parking garage was convenient but had a cost similar to other garages. It did have unlimited in and out privileges. There are many good restaurants nearby and most things that we wanted were within walking distance. We did drive to the zoo which was also not difficult. We were a bit hesitant about spending $15.00 for the breakfast buffet, but were quickly reminded that the kids could eat for free. This brought it to a reasonable cost for a family of four. The kids loved the pool, however, there were no towels available in the pool area. We will definitely consider returning here!

Reviews.Title: “restored my faith in Novotel's!”
Reviews.Author: LMouse
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our 2 night stay as part of our train trip across Canada - it was perfect. close enough to walk to and from the station, near great restaurants and bars. Just great. It was so much better than the very average Novotel's in Europe, we were very pleasantly surprised as we had prepared ourselves to this hotel being the low point of our trip. I will never compare paris Novotel to this one again - they were world's apart. Lovely friendly staff, good breakfast, large room with city views, Can't fault it really. Rooms clean and spacious, good bathroom with toiletries, Small but quiet pool, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: HenkEindhoven
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business. Hotel is ok. Staff is friendly. Rooms and bathrooms are clean and well equipped. Location is perfect, right in Centre, 5 mintes walk from convention centre

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay made by friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Charisse
Reviews.Content: The Novotel was booked through a website offering special deals for short breaks in Toronto. We chose it because of price and location and can honestly say we were not one bit disappointed. We had 2 rooms adjacent to each other, unfortunately they were smoking rooms, but the staff did provide some ventilating machine to remove any tobacco smells, which in fact were mininmal anyway. The rooms were large and bright, simply furnished and clean. The bathroom was also spacious with a good shower. Not knowing Toronto at all, we found the location to be central to the main attractions, all within walking distance. What really made our stay was the friendliness of the staff. They were welcoming and helpful and remembered small details about you which made it seem like they genuinely cared and wanted you to have a great holiday. I was so impressed with certain members of staff, I wrote a letter to the hotel manager complimenting them on their service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Anonam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during a trip to Canada and thought it was really good. We caught the airport shuttle bus for only $38 CA return which I thought was a bargain as it is a good 40 min journey even longer if traffice is bad. The shuttle doesnt usually drop off at this hotel but there was a few customers staying at the Novotel when we were there and the bus driver was feeling generous and dropped us off just around the corner. Failing that your nearest stop is the Fairmont!! Check in was quick and easy - our room was really nice. We had a king size bed, wide screen tv with lots of channels, seating area, tea and coffee making facilities, wardrobe and safe and full size modern bathroom. Rooms were thoroughly cleaned. The only dis advantage I would point out was the vw - if you are at the front of the hotel you over look a building site or the back of the hotel is just blocks of flats so try and get on the back as it is a lot quieter!! We never tried breakfast but the price looked pretty good compared to City Prices. My boyfriend used the pool and sauna which were pool clean. One thing I would say about this hotel is the staff were great. The guy on Concierge helped us every day with our plans even though we didnt book any trips through him. Also after our stay in Toronto we were going to Niagara for 2 nights and didnt really want to take our huge cases so we left them free of charge in left luggage until we came back to Toronto to fly home :) Another handy hint there is a small super market next door which sells all sorts and lots of restaurants just over the roday from the hotel. Spaghetti Factory is amazing inside and really good value for money. The location of the hotel is good - 2 mins walk from the Railways Station and about 5 mins to the CN tower and 10 mins to the HarbourFront. Would definately rec for a good clean base!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, despite one rude hotel employee”
Reviews.Author: iheartnewcities
Reviews.Content: We had a similar experience as the other reviewer - being pressured into taking queens rather than the king bed that I had reserved AND confirmed over the phone the day prior to check-in. It's probably the same man - he informed us he would give us a room with two queen beds "for no additional charge". I had to firmly tell him I reserved a King non-smoking and that's what I expected. The other annoying thing is that the hotel has all their spring water and mini bar items on electronic sensors that instantly and automatically charge items to your card if moved. We made sure to stay far far away! Everything else was actually really good. The room and bathroom were beautiful and comfortable, and the service / cleaning staff were friendly and responsive.

Reviews.Title: “Overall not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Lovewaves
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel over the phone in full for the promotional rate that had no cancellations-no changes which was to be a king room with buffet breakfast included for Saturday night. We arrived a little earlier than check in time (1/2hr earlier) and when the girl called up the reservation said "for queen room". Instantly my husband said that was an error. She then said no kings were available at this time. She did call to see if any were being cleaned and told us to come back for 3pm. We had no problem with this. (At the same time another couple were checking in and I overheard he booked a king smoking room - 6th floor and he had NO problems - why is that?) At 3pm we got another person behind the desk and again he says "for queen". I told him we just went through this already and told me to then wait and talk to the girl I had spoken to earlier. When I did she said she had a room available...then the guy I spoke to comes over and says to me that (within that 5mins) that it did NOT show a king available. My husband overhears and comes over to counter and is a little upset. He could not understand when he pays in full for a specific room and he has hassles...then the guy talks condescendingly to him and states that it is only "a request and that I guess you has never booked with hotels before"...and while my husband is still speaking to him, decides to ignore him; speak over him and proceed to tell me the facilities available. I found this VERY RUDE. In our room the bathroom toilet did not flush properly which was very frustrating. It would take you at least 4 TIMES to flush toilet paper down. The scrambled eggs at breakfast were runny (and I am not a picky eater). There was good selection. Upon check out again not smooth. We were told we owed some more money...1 long distance charge (approx. $40) and breakfast. We said that charge was not ours (that we never even picked up the telephone receiver once in our room)...that was fixed...and for breakfast that was already on the bill so there was no need to mention that; a little confusing. Overall I will NOT stay at this hotel again and not recommend it either. The people behind the counter made it unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, great location”
Reviews.Author: glasschick
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via their website, and paid all up front for 8 nights more than a month before our arrival date. When we got there, our double queen room had been given away, and we were given a king size bed. Given that my friend and I did not want to sleep together, they gave us a cot. There were various explanations about why this happened, including that they overbooked. They gave us a breakfast voucher. We had various issues the next day trying to get our booked room, and the front desk staff was atrocious! We ended up speaking to the manager and she didn't do anything other than listen. Because the windows don't open and the cooling had not been turned on for the summer, our room was uncomfortably hot. An engineer finally came up, and did what he could but it did not help much. Upon checkout, despite no extra room charges like minibar or room service, we were told we owed $30. The clerk said it was for a)new room taxes, then b)tax on the free breakfast they gave us for the first nights problems, and finally c)for the cot "we" ordered. It took quite a while to try and explain that we were being charged for things we had thrust upon us, and we left less than satisfied by the whole experience. Every time we were at the front desk, people were complaining about being charged different than quoted rates, not getting their booked room or other issues, so we were not alone. The front desk staff seemed to make up reasons on a whim, and changed them when they were questioned. Pros - excellent location, with great restaurants nearby, the food in the hotel was good, although the restaurant was empty most of the time and the room was clean and quiet. Cons - horrible service, hot room, HORRIBLE service, very finicky elevators! The people having sex in the hot tub was annoying but not the hotels fault...

Reviews.Title: “Scammed on room rate”
Reviews.Author: Manteo97
Reviews.Content: After calling direct and confirming government rate of $139 per night for 2 nights for a weekend, we were presented the bill at $159 per night upon check out. The Asst Manager on duty was inflexible and we were disappointed at her rationale for not adjusting the bill back to the confirmed price. I work for the Ontario government, and this is the first hotel we have encountered ever, not to honour their quoted/confirmed price. Put a sour taste on an otherwise good stay. Will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “A warm refuge on a snowy night”
Reviews.Author: CAStein
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this proprety one snowy night at the end of February. Check in was efficient and I was "sold" an upgrade to a superior room that promised to "redfine the hotel room experience," or some such. Elevators sometimes required and sometimes read key cards to access your floor. The room itself was very large, modern with accents in primary colors and very clean and new-looking. What was to "redefine" the traditional hotel stay was the large white bathroom. This was accessed through translucent panelled doors in one corner of the room. The most unusual aspect of the bathroom however was the large soaking tub with "rain shower" fixture overhead and adjacent large widow looking back into the bedroom area. A "privacy screen" for this could be lowered electronically from inside of the bathroom. Unfortunately this screen was placed on the bedroom-side of the window allowing little ones (or whoever one is wanting privacy from) to simply lift the curtain and see full scale into the bath unit! Overall room maintenance and cleanliness was excellent except the desk light was not functioning and the in-bed reading lights were of a low wattage and not particulary functional in design. As it was a very wintry night, I opted to eat dinner in the hotel's restaurant as there were extremely limited options (Spaghetti Factory, Keg and Le Papillon (I ate there last summer and found it uninspired)) within easy walking distance. Upon entering the dining room, I was struck by the relatively small number of customers versus the large number of dirty tables and dirty plates on every flat service in sight. Apparently a large office party had just left. It took a few tries to get silverware, water and a glass of wine. But after this I found the service personnel, though frazzled, to be very friendly, knowledgeable and even funny. It seems many of them had been with the restaurant since its opening. My dinner of French onion soup (way too thick with bread) and croque monsieur (very dry) with salad was serviceable but hardly inspired. Overall, I had slightly above-average stay at this property. I would stay again but would not pay for the room upgrade and I would hope for better weather (or pay a taxi) allowing for a pleasant walk to Toronto's myriad outstanding restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you like it warm!”
Reviews.Author: zerotoeleven
Reviews.Content: The value for the price you pay is quite good. The rooms are all recently updated (or so we were told-we didn't see them all of course) and feature AMAZING bedding and a nice bed. Unfortunately, we were overly hot through the nights we were there, and there wasn't anything that could be done about it as the windows didn't open and the fan on the AC/Heating unit didn't do much, either. Great location, though, and the staff was pleasant enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: LetsBoogie
Reviews.Content: We are a Britsh family of four (two adults, two children 9 & 7). We stayed here at the Novotel for a total of five nights either side of a couple of days in Niagara, and overall we were very impressed. The room we had was large enough for the four of us with two big comfy double beds, as well as several small and thoughtful touches such as the presence of a dim night light in the bathroom. Tea drinkers note though that the coffee filter machine will produce coffee scented hot water which is not great for a cup of tea! Although the hotel is not far from the city centre, the rooms are very quiet, and warm (which is quite important when the outside temperature is several degrees below zero). The swimming pool is adequate - who after all is going to be spending a huge amount of time in the pool in a city centre hotel like this - but to sit in a nice warm jacuzzi tub after a dip was very welcome. Do make sure to sample the excellent buffet breakfast. It was freshly prepared and beautifully presented. Indeed, the evening meals were tasty as well - if not up to haute cuisine standard! But better though than the food in the Old Spaghetti Factory (nothing to do with this hotel) opposite which we found a bit disappointing. Overall comments: Helpful staff; clean, neat and modern decor; excellent breakfast; very convenient location; excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: DudleyBlockhead
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Christmas and New Year. Enjoyed every minute. Room was cleaned and used towels replaced every day. As was the tea and coffee etc. There were two big double beds very comfy. But could of done with some extra pillows as there was only one each. Large TV with plenty of channels. Hotel staff were polite and helpful. Not far from the CN Tower and other attractions. Meals and drinks in the hotel were very nice. A little bit expensive, avoid mini bar as that is very expensive. Swimming Pool very small for the size of the hotel. All in all great hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the key”
Reviews.Author: jewel_leaf
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here one night while downtown for a Leafs game one night then Raptors game the next day. Was better than I expected. The good: -room cleaner than most hotels. -check in/out really quick. -close to everything (ACC; good restaurants-Spaghetti factory across the street and Le Papillion restaurant close as well). -good price, about $125 on a Saturday, booked ahead online with their no-refund option. -room modern and furnished nicely. Not ugly like so many hotel rooms. The bad: -the only bad thing I can say is that it would have been ideal if parking was reduced from $20 for hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sydneytraveller63
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the last in a very long trip. We chose it due to its proximity to the Union Street Railway Station as we were travelling by train to Niagra Falls. The hotel was very clean, very friendly staff, a nice well priced restaurant downstairs and a great location in an otherwise bleak city. Our room was a great size considering it had two queen beds in it... We stayed for two nights at around $119 usd per night for four people. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Handy for everything”
Reviews.Author: bridgendbaggie
Reviews.Content: Good points; Great location, close to Hockey Hall of Fame, main railway station, St. Lawrence market, 10 mins walk to Eaton Centre, ferry to the Islands, 15 mins walk to CN Tower, Rogers stadium Loads of excellent pubs, restaurant, coffee shops in same street or nearby. Good sized rooms with very comfortable beds Nice restaurant and bar Good gym and swimming pool. Bad points; There is building work going on across the street - they start at 7:00am. Ask for a room at the rear of the hotel When completed (I would say 2/3 years time) it will be a twin-tower condominium which will totally dominate the hotel Too frightened to open the minibar door in case I got charged even though I didn't take anything - you'll see what I mean! Didn't have the room I booked five months in advance available

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: akwablu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for 3 nights and enjoyed the hotel. It lived up to the standard of the Accord hotel chain. The room was clean with a nice bathroom. Tea and coffee was complimentary, supplies refreshed everyday. The Old Spaghetti Factory is just across the street and cabs are always available. Close to Union Station and also very close to the fantastic Lawrence farmers market. Hotel staff were very helpful, when we wanted a weighing scale to check the weight of our luggage (airline restrictions!) before checking out, the front desk supervisor brought one up to our room! That's great service!!! They have a great travel desk facility that recommends sightseeing tours within Toronto and also books you on Niagara tours. Overall, we had a great stay at the Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: racerxgrl
Reviews.Content: My mother, sister and I stayed here for a girls' getaway weekend after reading and comparing reviews on Trip Advisor. This hotel was an incredible value in a great location! The 2 double-bed room was quiet, clean, roomy enough and the beds very comfortable. The inability to use the mini bar fridge for personal beverages was a slight inconvienence, but we just made lots of trips to the ice machine. The location was superb, lots of restaraunts near by and you can get the underground PATH right across the street to hit Toronto's best shopping. Book your room directly online for the best rates.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jospehine
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Novotel Toronto Centre this year and I plan on staying there again when I return to Toronto in December. Both times I've stayed at this hotel, I've found the staff to be exceedingly knowledgable and polite. I ordered dinner from room service every night during this recent stay and found the delivery to be prompt and complete. When I called to report a broken hair dryer one morning, it was replaced immediately. The on-site restaurant is quite nice, offering fresh pastries and espresso each morning in addition to a well-priced, complete breakfast buffet. They serve lunch and dinner as well. The location of this hotel could not be better. Located on the Esplanade, Union Station and the Underground are just a few short blocks away. The local area around the hotel is strewn with quaint shops, bookstores and coffee bars. There are several wonderful restaurants nearby and the neighborhood felt very safe late into the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Novotel!”
Reviews.Author: chrispigirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for three nights. We drove up and the parking was convenient - the hotel had a garage right underneath it. There was construction going on across the street, but you couldn't hear it when you were inside. The hotel was beautifully kept and the room was wonderful. It was very modern and the bed was one of the more comfortable beds I have ever slept in while traveling. The water pressure in the shower was amazing. Everything was clean. It was our first time in Toronto, and the staff was very helpful in directing us where to go, where to eat, how to get to places, etc. The Novotel is located in the downtown historic district, which we thought was the prettiest area of Toronto. There are a lot of really nice restaurants nearby, including The Old Spaghetti Factory, but the area is still pretty quiet. The hotel is right next to St. Lawrence Market, and near the Distillery and the Harbor. It is a little further from but still walking distance to the Eaton Center. It was pretty far away from the Bloor-Yorkville shopping area, but the subway was easy enough to take. We only had two minor complaints about the hotel. Most of the restaurants they recommended were expensive, and we didnâ€™t want to pay that much for every dinner. However, we never asked for recommendations to less-expensive restaurants, so maybe that was our fault. Also, I have a small appetite so I always have leftovers after dinner. There was no place in the room to keep the leftovers cold, since you couldnâ€™t put your own food in the minibar. So if youâ€™re likely to have leftovers, bring a cooler. Travelers Tip: We went on Bruce Bellâ€™s walking tour of the Old Town. He is one of the premier historians of Toronto and was amazing. He is very personable and animated. He also takes you through St. Lawrence Market and gives you complementary food samples during the tour.

Reviews.Title: “Tucked Away on The Esplanade”
Reviews.Author: Cheap Jeff
Reviews.Content: This Fall 2006 we were meeting friends in Toronto to see the last of three Oakland Athletics vs. Toronto Blue Jays baseball games at The Roger's Centre. We booked our room through Expedia. Upon arrival about 1 PM on a Thursday, there wasn't any King / Non-Smoking rooms ready. The front desk held our luggage for us, had us park our car in the underground garage and we went to the hotel bar for a drink. The underground parking is convenient, very close to the hotel, with an elevator that goes directly to the lobby (~$20 added to hotel bill). I guess there was a pool somewhere at Novotel, but we never got to see it, maybe next time. The rooms were very nice and the beds extermely comfortable. Also available for an extra charge is a room upgrade to a Novo-suite, however we didn't see any of those to compare. Some of the things that are an easy walk: St. Lawrence Market, The Hummingbird Centre for the Arts, and the Hockey Hall of Fame. However the Roger's Centre and the Hippo Tour were both about a 10 minute walk West. An expensive but very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room with no view- So What!!”
Reviews.Author: Dennybaby
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent 2 weeks in Ontario the last 4 nights of which were spent at this hotel. I booked it because of its location and not for the view. Our room is for sleeping in and not for sightseeing. The staff were very helpful when approached and had an easy efficient manner. The rooms were of a good size and well served with facillities eg ironing board & iron, tea/coffee making facilities, internet access, 2 King size beds , a coffe table and 2 easy chairs. The pool area was excellent, being very clean and the temperature was just right in both. That area was backed up by a first class fitness room. We never eat in our hotels, preferring to find interesting restaurants and there were a number in the vicinity. Downtown Toronto was only a short stroll away as was the Harbour, CN Tower and the Rogers Centre. We picked an interesting time to visit, as the Toronto International Film festival was in full swing. All in all, we had a memorable visit. 2 Active Oldies from Perth, Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Novotel could have been better”
Reviews.Author: billyjoe1
Reviews.Content: Hi all, Let me start off and say I really enjoyed my stay in Toronto. There was so much to do and just not enough time to do it all in 4 days. I stayed at the Novotel on the Esplanade. Location was great! I was so close to Union Station and St. Lawrence Market. The parking was also good with in/out priveleges. But down the street you could park for $5 instead of $18 Novotel charged. The rooms were nice with a european modern look. But the view I had was awful as I stared at the garage. The room was a bit small. I could have gotten a larger room if I upgraded to the Deluxe Novation Room. The breakfast buffet was a bit disappointing. For $14.95 aperson it wasn't a good deal. The food was sometimes cold and there wasn't a variation of selection each day. We actually enjoyed going to St. Lawrence Market to eat which was much cheaper, had a better selection and just a stone's throw away. The maids weren't very good. Each day it was something new. One day we had a towel missing, another we had my girlfriend's eye glass cleaner missing and another day the hotel restaurant was missing. I did leave a complaint to Novotel and they just apologized. Novotel was a nice stay in Toronto. The next time I'll probably try a different hotel. Sincerely, Billyjoe1

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Service, Facilities”
Reviews.Author: mikebluesz
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location. Very clean and good service. dont hesitate to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Shopping before returning to UK”
Reviews.Author: Quickie
Reviews.Content: We were a family of four adults who had been travelling for two weeks across western Canada and had decided to break our journey from Edmonton back to the UK by staying in Toronto to do some shopping. We had booked two rooms for 2 nights and I had chosen the hotel through Expedia for its convenient downtown location. Good points were that the staff were friendly and efficient and that we had two very good interconnecting rooms with big comfy beds and the usual amenities such as coffee maker and big TV with lots of cable channels for our 18 and 22-year old. This was the only hotel in our stay in Canada that charged for water although the coffee was complimentary. The rooms had a mini bar which we used as a fridge. Access to the lifts is by plastic room key so you need a key for each person staying. One negative point was that there was demolition work going on immediately opposite the hotel as part of construction of a new condominium building. I got woken up early by the noise of pneumatic drills and excavators. Might be less of a problem if you stay on one of the higher floors. The rooms have double glazing and the rest of the family did not hear the noise - I am a light sleeper. We did not eat in the hotel, being a family that knows Toronto well from previous visits and prefers to eat out. The restaurant looked pleasant and there are many other great eating places locally. The big advantage of this hotel for us was its location, close to attractions such as the Eaton Centre for shopping or sights such as the CN Tower and Rogers Arena (aka Skydome). If in Toronto again we would be happy to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff ....shame about the rooms”
Reviews.Author: hannah's grandma
Reviews.Content: My elderly Aunt and i stayed here four days from 9 - 13 June. I had requested a non-smoking twin room but got a smoking twin room. The stench was horrendous (made worse i expect by the fact that we are both ex-smokers). The air-con unit was on one wall which blew cold air onto the curtains and to the person (me) unfortunate enough to be sleeping in the bed nearest the window. I asked for a room change but was told there was nothing available. We were not offered an upgrade probably because i booked with AirMiles/Cash so they probably though we were getting the room cheap anyway! It wasn't until the Monday morning at 7am that we realised how bad the noise from the building site opposite actually was! Pile driving isn't quiet! We had no choice but to get up...thank goodness we were leaving the next day. According to reception they are building a block of condos and will be busy for the next 2 years. I advised anyone NOT to accept an "odd" numbered room. Having said that, the breakfast and dinners we had in their restaurant were fabulous. The staff were great each day wearing a different World Cup country polo shirt (and we wanted to get away from that!). The pool/jacuzzi offered a welcome relief after pounding the streets too. The Spaghetti Factory over the road was superb and i couldn't fault the location of the hotel but, if a member of your party has difficulty walking just be aware that the CN Tower isn't quite as close as it looks!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “RESERVATIONS WORTHLESS”
Reviews.Author: buffbill54
Reviews.Content: We had reservations for a King Sized room with smoking for two nights. When we arrived at 4:00 pm (check-in is 3:00pm) We were told that there was no king rooms available. The attitude at the desk was take a room with two doubles or ,"oh well". I had done quite a bit a research regarding this hotel and especially on this site. I was warned but the overall reviews were positive.
