My advice when travelling to Toronto, have reservations at two hotels so that when the Novotel doesn't have what you had a confirmed reservation for you can still cancel before 6:00pm. We live in Buffalo and frequent Toronto quite a bit, but it will be a LONG!!!!!! time before I go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: young7898
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel with a distinct European feel. Large rooms very tastefully decorated. Breakfast buffet was very good, and reasonably priced at around $14. Parking is easily available in the lot under the hotel, and costs about $18 per day, with full in-and-out privileges.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: grancha
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the Novotel Hotel on The Esplanade and we were very pleased with our stay. The hotel staff were very helpful. The rooms were spacious and well equiped. The location is very good for main attractions. Bar staff very cheerful and not too familiar. Breakfast was excellent and a good choice of options. We would recommend this hotel for most types of travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spotty service”
Reviews.Author: adomatic
Reviews.Content: I admit, I was excited when I read a review where the poster was able to check in early. I was hoping we'd be able to do the same. We arrived on a Saturday morning and the only rooms available were smoking or queen. We were offered a non-smoking king, but at an additional $40 a day. They told us to check back around noon. We came back at 1pm and were told the same story, no room. We actually got to see and do more because we didn't end up checking in until after 7pm! The next day, we came back from touring the city around 5:30pm and the maid hadn't made it to our room yet! She was right outside, so we just grabbed some towels from her and hit the indoor pool. The pool seems to be were familes entertain their children, in the pool and in the hot tub. We were surrounded. Not very relaxing, but felt good after pounding the Toronto pavement. When we got back to the room, the maid still hadn't finished our room! She eventually emptied the garbage, threw the bedspread on the bed and left! She was very nice and did check back with us later to see if we needed anything. But returning at 5pm, I expect the room clean. The concierge is very helpful, when he's on duty. He reserved one dinner for us, and when we went back the next day, he wasn't on duty. The hotel is in a great location, close to the St. Lawrence Market and lots of bars and restaurants. Quieter area than the Suites at King West, which was our 2nd choice. My travelmate said he would stay again at the Novotel. I wouldn't have a problem staying there again, since i liked the location. But i would also like to try something else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in early May 2006 and were very happy with the experience. The rooms were well equipped and comfortable. The breakfast buffet is very tasty and reasonably priced. It is located slightly away from the centre of Toronto (10min walk) but the hotel is surrounded by good restaurants, boutique style shops and is near St Lawrence market which is a large and well regarded produce market - a good stop for lunch or breakfast if you don't fancy paying $11-14 CDN for the buffet. There is also free internet access available for those that don't carry a laptop. One thing to mention is that there is building work going on opposite the hotel which may mean some early morning construction noise for the foreseeable future. I have to particularly praise this hotel as we requested a very early check-in due to an overnight flight from Vegas and they had our room ready at 9am rather than the usual 2pm check-in. Fantastic service and much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is excellent. If i were returning to toronto again i would definately stay there again. The rooms are all fresh and modern, clean and tidy. The pool is large (as far as hotel pools go) and below there is a gym which has all modern equipment. The reason we stayed was we knew novotel had a pretty good reputation and again we were prooved right. The breakfasts were free for my kids and very reasonable for me and my wife. The hotel is located in a very conveniant place, right in the centre. It has good transport links (for if you want to travel further afield) as the train station is a 5 min walk away from which you can get a regular train to Niagara Falls. Also if you go to Toronto you would have to go to the st. Lawrence Market and its right on your doorstep. From where the Novotel is based everything is within close walking range, like a real "right in the middle hotel" but unlike a "right in the middle" hotel you can actually sleep at night as there is no annoying noise. The staff were all pleasent and helpful and even when we had a very slight problem with the towels within 5 minutes the problem had been sorted. This place is excellent value for money, and having personally stayed in many hotels in Toronto i would consider this probably the best one :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Novotel”
Reviews.Author: TrishP
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with our three night stay at the Novotel. We were greeted with a smile, and check in was very quick and efficient. Security was good - your room key had to be inserted in the lift before it would work (the only hotel that did this, out of six that we stayed in). We were delighted to find that our rooms were the newly renovated ones (we had only paid for the standard room, so that was a nice surprise) - good size, spotlessly clean and with good bathrooms and comfortable beds. The location was excellent too - we walked everywhere (even with teenagers!), with no need for public transport. We had only one evening meal in the restaurant - efficient, friendly staff, and no complaints about the food. We ate close to the hotel on a couple of occasions - we enjoyed The Old Spaghetti Factory across the road, and the Richtree Market on Yonge Street. Favourite breakfast was at the Over Easy, also on Yonge Street. All in all, an excellent stay - we loved Toronto, and wouldd definitely use the Novotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean. Bar staff were friendly and made you feel welcome. Always remembering what you have talked about the previous day. Concierge is very helpful. Rooms are clean and good size. Remember to not lift up the bottle water or things in the minibar as they are detected and will be charged to your bill. Hotel is great for people wanting to watch the sports events at the Air Canada Centre (4 min walk) and at the Rogers Stadium (6 min walk). Also not far from CN Tower and Union Station. Good restaurants in area too. Only downside, is there is building work going on in front of the hotel, but not too noisy. They generally started early and finished early. I will stay at this hotel next time I am in Toronto as it is so close for sporting events.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location.”
Reviews.Author: glasg0w_gal
Reviews.Content: We had a not so great start to this hotel - the twin room we had booked turned out to be a double and when we were moved next day it was to a smoking room when we had requested non-smoking. But to their credit we were allocated another room, right next door to our friends, within a couple of hours. Apart from this glitch our week's stay was fantastic. The rooms were clean and large, the pool was nearly always deserted so we had it all to ourselves, the staff were quick to help us with queries and the location is great for getting around (you can walk to the cn tower in about 10mins) and eating out (there are several restaurants and pubs right across the road). All in all i would highly recommend this hotel and only wish i was going back to toronto this year as its one of the best holidays i have ever had!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in TO”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay, friendly help and a free upgrade!!!My boyfriend and I had plans to spend the weekend in TO. Being from WNY I have stayed in TO many times. When we checked in they said the hotel was pretty book but we could be upgraded to the new suites that were due to open in one week. WHAT A WONDERFUL SUPRISE! The suite was amazing, clean, modern and had a great view. (rainfall showers, flat screen TVs, bright big windows, clean comfortable sitting area,internet, the works).The front desk was welcoming and all I can say is we did not have ONE complaint. We acutally wanted to stay another night but the hotel was booked up. I would def stay again. We are planning on another trip in Feb and I already booked. I have not stayed in other rooms but I do recommend spending the exta money for the concept room/suites. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “WOW! what a surprise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visit Toronto regularly and this time I stayed at the Novotel. I was recieved at the desk by a pleasent smile. The room as I was told was their new Novation which was absolutely the comfortable and bright that I have seen in recent years. It was a very good stay! I would recommend this hotel to anyone in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “yukky surprise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While our room was great the doggy doo-doo in the halls was not! After once reporting dog feces outside the elevator one night to a staff member, we woke up to it the next morning to find it all over the carpet outside our door. What gives? I again reported it, this time to the front desk, and not even an apology! Totally ruined what would have been an otherwise lovely stay and I'm sure the hotel would have known who on our floor would have had a dog (let's put it this way - not a small dog!)

Reviews.Title: “lovely new rooms”
Reviews.Author: Skevin
Reviews.Content: My wife and kids spent christmas eve in Toronto, and chose this hotel due to its central location near all shopping and the Go station. We stayed on the 3rd floor in one of their new rooms, with new beds and duvets. one of the best nights sleep I have had in a long time. My kids were given the dolfi gifts and breakfast for kids was free. Loved the bed in the lobby Great stay!!!! Highly recommended.........

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently attended the PETA conference at Novotel Toronto Centre in October and would like to say the hotel is delightful, staff are so courteous and the food for the conference was amazing too! The staff who were serving the food at breakfast and lunch were all so friendly and polite and the staff who greeted us on arrival were amazing too. We loved the room, especially the new Novation room. All in all it was a fantastic stay and would certainly recommend and stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay @ the Novotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the Novotel for one night and so far I have recommended it to several people. The room was absolutely welcoming and comfortable. Every single detail was covered from the soothing colours, the plush comforter to the closeup mirror in the bathroom. I highly recommend this hotel and will be staying there whenever I need to be downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Boasts stained carpet and cold rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel for a long 4 nights at the end of September. The foyer and reception area looks good, but overall the rooms are very disappointing. Our first room allocation, was smelly and had black stains on the orange carpet. We rejected this room and were eventually allocated a second room, which although a cleaner smell, the carpet was still badly stained. The rooms and the corridor were extremely cold. (I would'nt like to be their in a Canadian winter) So cold were the rooms that there was condensation on the toilet cistern, which we thought was a leak. The food was OK. But overall I would not stay there again, if you paid me

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed wit service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked a non smoking room back in the spring and was told non available we had to take a smoking room. Also arrived a little early around two o'clock and was told there was no rooms available yet because checkin time wasn't til 3, which would have been fine but while we were waiting other people arrived and got right in a room. So went back to desk and asked them to check on rooms available and he says oh there is one. Was not impressed with service and desk cerks were not very freindly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “SERVICE EXCELLENCE”
Reviews.Author: WINGSUNLIMITED
Reviews.Content: Good evening, It gives me great pleasure to write of my experience this week at Novotel, Toronto Cente, Ontario Canada. This week I had the privledge of staying at Novotel. What could have been a disappointing stay turned out just simply marvellous because of a dedicated and customer driven employee, Ms. Rhonda Wilson. This week was the films festival in Toronto Canada. I fould it extremely difficult to book a hotel during the week of September 11 - 17 any where in down town Toronto. I had called several hotels and was just flatly refused, we are sold out, good-bye. This was not the case with Rhonda Wilson of Novotel, Toronto Centre. She advised me they were booked but promised to keep me updated on the capacity of the hotel. True to her word she called me backand advised that she was able to accomodate me for Sunday, Tuesday and Wednesday night. She will also recommend that I spend the Monday night at one of the hotels other property in Missasagua if I did not mind. She then went on to find out whether or not I need transportation to the hotel and pre-arranged cab service for us. When I arrived at the hotel on Sunday evening, there I met Ms. Wilson, a very energetic and smiling employee who welcomed me and my business partner to the hotel. She assisted us with our check in and came to our rooms to ensure we were pleased with our surroundings. She again remined us that at present she was unable to accomodate us the following night due to the overbooking but had made arrangements for us to stay at one of the other properties in Missasagua. We would then return on Tuesday to check into the Toronto Centre for the remainder of the week. Ms. Wilson also made recommendations for dinner, arranged transportation to and from the hotel each day as well as our transfer to the Missagua hotel. Each evening she checked on us to see how our day went, were there any questions or concerns. You were simply welcomed and felt at home. I personally observed Ms. Wilson in action with other guest as this was an extremely busy time at the hotel as all hotels in Toronto were over booked. Yet she was calm, warm, friendly, courteous and professional to each guest walking through the door. The service Ms. Wilson gives guarantees return vistors to Novotel and Toronto Canada. Employers should pay special recognition to such Star employees. Had I not encountered Ms. Wilson in making my reservations at Novotel, my business trip would have had to be postponed which would have resulted in a major delay. Going above and beyond is what makes or breaks the tourist destination. Ms. Wilson is truly an AMBASSADOR for Toronto and the Novotel chain. This is excellence in it's truest form. What a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “a $90 type hotel for $150 beacause in city location”
Reviews.Author: adembik
Reviews.Content: Nice location- easy walk to St Lawrence market within 5 minutes (go there for breakfast saturday). Also walked to Eaton Centre and Harbour Front (do this only if you are in shape). Some nice views of city and CN tower near. Hotel is pleasant-room small and efficient. Clean as a whistle. Front desk brisk (Holly). Be warned-Parking and breakfast are extra! Got to the Irish pub on the corner- very good! Overall- a $90 type hotel for $150 beacause in city location.

Reviews.Title: “could do better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel recently in a family room with my two teenage sons. The room was a little cramped but everything was very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The location was perfect for exploring Toronto on foot, and the convenient Hotel parking made it easy if you had a car for any further afiled trips. The pool was fairly small but the hotel gym was superb, up to date all fully working equipment and air conditioned. I think the hotel is more suited to a business trip than family holiday with kids, but overall our stay here was pleasant and hassle free.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could be better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Novotel is in a good location and it's pretty good value. I wasn't that impressed with our room - there was a vaguely musty smell which I hated and it was very much standard furnishings. Still, breakfast was good and the staff were helpful so, all in all, not bad - just not great!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: RABSREVIEWS
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in a central location for exploring downtown Toronto. Our room was clean and tidy with a comfortable bed.However, it was a bit dark as we had no real natural light. The staff were helpful and polite in dealing with any queries. Directly acoss from the hotel are a row of bars and restaurants where you can unwind after a hard day,s sightseeing. During our time in Toronto we stayed here and also the Best Western Primrose and we preferred the Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Americanuck
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip as it was more economical that some of the nicer places but for the rate I expected more. The lobby gave a more positive impression which changed the minute I stepped out of the elevators to my floor. The carpets were old and burn marked (even on the non-smoking floor, the walls had paint chipping and were fairly dirty looking. In the alcove with the ice machine were stacked cardboard boxes and dirty rags which didn't leave a nice visual impression. The room was fairly spacious but the sitting area was pretty gross. The 'couch' was sagging the material looked unclean. The one thing I can say is their bathrooms are great, large and what appears to be fairly recently renovated. This hotel needs some TLC to upgrade it.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay here very much!”
Reviews.Author: WBinBC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel downtown Toronto for one week, and enjoyed our stay very much. The rooms are large and comfortable. The bathrooms are newly-remodelled, spacious and clean (granite countertops, good lighting, excellent shower and bath). Excellent service from the staff and housekeeping, and the hotel itself is in a good overall location--nice and quiet and safe location. Hotel is across from the "Old Spaghetti Factory" restaurant, and there is a convenience store located next door. We were within walking distance to shopping, theatres, CN Tower, Union Station, etc. There is a decent-sized indoor pool with large hot tub, and in addition the gym facilites are the best I've seen in a hotel this size (lots of equipment and free weights in addition to weight machines). There's also a men's and ladies' sauna. Overall, good value for your dollar--safe, clean, modern, and good service. The only minor complaint is that the carpets although fairly new need to be re-stretched. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Novotel is perfect for families going to the Hummingbird (formerly O'Keefe) Centre. It's within a 2 minute walk. The family suite was spacious for our family of four (kids aged 5 and 2). The kids loved the trundle bed. The new bathrooms were huge. The carpet is old and could be replaced. A newspaper was deliver to our door on Saturday (but not Sunday). The breakfast was high quality and free for children (buffet $15). At breakfast the kids were given Dolphi placemats, cups and toys to entertain themselves. The pool is ideal for families but not big enough for those wanting to do laps. The Fitness Room has also been redone to include flat screen tvs at each cardio machine! Unfortunately the two drink machines I tried were empty. But the Gift Shop had reasonably priced snacks and a mini-grocery is next door. The parking rate is very reasonable for Toronto ($17) and it permits "in and out " privileges. Every staff member we encountered were amicable and accommodating. We would stay at Novotel again if we were planning to attend something nearby (Hockey Hall of Fame, Young Peoples Theatre). Plan now for The Nutcracker!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Steinera
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel in downtown Toronto for one night in May 2005. We checked in at noon and were able to keep the room until 1 p.m. the next day. The room was big but although the window faces the sea, all we could see were the cars in the parking -and they could see us. The furniture is functional and modern but is badly kept. The carpet had not been properly gued to the floor and blanket had lots of holes in it (presumably cigarette burns although it was a non-smoking room). The bathroom was big but simple and did not have enought toiletries or towels. We had a great breakfast buffet in the morning. This was the first time on our trip in north America that we were able to eat a breakfast that contained more than pancakes, waffles and other fried food. There were different kinds of European breads, healthfood, fruit and what not. Since we did not eat any of the warm food, our bill was lower than expected and said "cold buffet". The hotel is close to the financial center and the St Lawrence market and there was not problem getting around town on foot and by subway from the Union station which is very close. In short, the hotel is average but I would highly recommend that you go there for breakfast even if you don't stay in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: great location had a quad room good size. The breakfast is great value the staff very helpful. Made use of pool and gym great when you have children dont forget to add taxes on your bill when checking out

Reviews.Title: “Good location but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located and within walking distance of the major sights. Our room was clean and sufficient. If you expect to see the skyline of Toronto beware, our view was of the parking garage at the rear of the hotel. Speaking of parking, they do add a hefty parking fee (per day) to the room rate. On the plus side of things, if you have concerns for your personal safety...you might like the idea that the elevators can only be operated by inserting your room key. All in all a pleasant experience but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Good location , clean and tidy”
Reviews.Author: UKperson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from April 14th for 5 nights. A few minutes walks from Union Station ( and Royal York Hotel ) so getting to / from using the airport bus was no problem. Room clean and tidy , plenty of hot water . Staff attentive and friendly . Only had breakfast once, as location puts it 5 mins from St. Lawrence Mkt which has plenty of eateries. Pool a bit small for proper swimming ( 12 meters I think ) but fine for a bit of a work out swim training. Gym had lots of new eqpt and Tv screens as well. Would definitely stay here again and reccomend to others. More "downtown" and close to business district / harbour as opposed to centre and nearer shops but whats a few minutes walk ? A few beggars / pan handlers of an evening in area ( not at hotel but at bars / restaurants across road) but they seemed to be non aggressive .

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: blindmind
Reviews.Content: The Problems: - EXTREMELY RUDE employees- ESPECIALLY if you have a web based reservation (they treated me like I was on welfare). - Tons of HIDDEN costs (e.g. didn't mention parking fee when I checked in charged me $20 for one night of parking when I checked out). - The room was as far as possible from the elevator (even though the hotel was nearly empty). The Benfits: - Decent sized room. Good location. Great gym with a sauna. Ok (small swimming pool). All in all I will NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for business. The location was great - close to Union Station and walking distance from many restaurants and shopping areas in Toronto. My booking was a little troublesome. I had called ahead of time and requested a pre-authorization form be faxed to me so I would be able to bill it to my company Visa. The form was faxed a week later, after my company had contacted them three times. Upon arriving at my room after a tiring flight, my room door was held wide open using a bath towel. I was unsure if someone was still cleaning it or if it was to air-out the room (I'm assuming the latter since cleaning staff never came back to my room). My Internet service was problematic. After 1 hour of playing with the modem, one call to concierge and one call to the actual Internet supplier, we realized that the previous tenant had stolen the power jack to the in-room modem. However, the hotel staff were very speedy in replacing it and restoring the Internet access to the room. My sleep could be better. I was awaken at 4am everyday to someone running up and down the stairs (I was located near the end of a wing). I'm assuming they were delivering the complementary newpaper to each guest but it was disruptive nonetheless. When checking out, I did not recieve a statement of the amount that had been charged. I called twice after leaving the hotel before a statement was faxed to me. Despite the hardships, the hotel is secure (a keycard operated elevator!) and the staff are friendly. They were helpful in finding locationsin Toronto. The telephone operator could be more available as there were several times that I called and no one was there to pick-up the telephone. As my review title states, it's a great location but a little more work into detailing would give Novotel the "umph" that it needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: iamthespark
Reviews.Content: Stayed just 1 night for New Years. We got a great price from expedia. The room was small, but clean. Great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Steveℜen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on January 25th and 26th for two nights. The hotel is average. The rooms are certainly not comparable to the Cambridge Suites or Marriot, but either is the price. The rooms are a little outdated and in need of some renovations. The washrooms were nice. Make sure you ask for a room facing the Esplanade. Otherwise, you see the concrete from the Gardiner Expressway out your window. The pool is small and cold. They just finished maintenance, so hopefully it was heating up again. This hotel's location is awesome. Walking distance to everything you could want. It is a good value for the price paid. Just don't expect a five star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently in Nov/Dec 04, the staff were very friendly and helpful. We were upgraded from a double to a king room which is always a nice thing, the room was great and tidy, the bathroom was very big, and there was complimentary coffee and tea in the room. The concierge helped with booking a trip to Niagara Falls which was fantastic. The underground PATH shopping centre was close, about 2 blocks walk away, the MARCHE was quite a nice eatery in the BCE Place building, it offered a take-away or sitdown meal. The hotel is downtown in the financial area and is close to the bus station and the Union station metro. All in all it was a great location for a fantastic holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice service, but the hotel needs some TLC”
Reviews.Author: cherylstar
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay here. Okay hotel. As previously stated by another reviewer (maybe more), the rooms are dated and the carpet alone almost made me give this hotel 2 stars - stained and old. We solved the problem of the snacks on the sensor pads by having them immediately removed from our room by calling the front desk. That said, the room was clean and the staff efficient and courteous. Everything was in walking distance and this was in 40 degree weather. Previous reviewers that have said it's not close enough must really be out-of-shape. There are at least 50+ restaurants and hundreds of stores plus many theaters within a 15 minute walk. Would I stay here again? I guess that would depend on the price of nearby hotels. We paid $266 with taxes for 2 nights (parking is another $16). I would probably pay another $40-60 per night for a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A 2 Star at best”
Reviews.Author: nicoleclive
Reviews.Content: I was very dissapointed in this hotel, the photos online are deceiving, The location is good, however the rooms were not very clean and were very dated, very small and esthetically unapealing. There are stains on the hall carpets and the walls are dirty. Not very well kept at all. Could also smell cigarettes in my non-smoking room. Little bedding and uncomfortable bed. Cannot say anything positive. Oh and don't move anything from the sensor pad or you will have to pay (chips etc) I would rate this a 2 star at best. Not a warm and fuzzy place at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Jolysa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business in September. The hotel was quite nice and we really liked the location--aside from being very convenient to just about everything, it's a couple blocks away from the St. Lawrence Market (highly recommend) and close to many good neighborhood restaurants and bars. Skip the Cafe Nicole and go across the street to one of the three Irish pubs--they're great! I would have given Novetel five stars if the bed had had a down comforter and the furniture were a bit nicer, but it was perfectly nice nonetheless.
